","
Business Function
 Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. 
Responsibilities
  • Kubernetes, Docker Administration, GPU Platform support
  • Supporting application onboarding process on container & GPU platform
  • Supporting machine learning application and apps running on container platform
  • Help in application transformation to microservices and containerization
  • Identifies issues proactively using required tools for all components.
  • Assists in ensuring compliance with security policies and procedures.
  • Getting involved in upgrade projects and new feature development.
  • Knowledge about container orchestration tools like docker and logging/monitoring tools for these orchestration tools.
  • Maintain and improve Kubernetes & Docker-based infrastructure
  • Perform day-to-day administration tasks including maintenance, patches, upgrades and security configurations
  • Find solutions to problems that disrupt the availability, performance, and stability of our systems
  • Work in conjunction with the development and operations team to understand requirements for functionality, performance, and security of applications
  • Explore and maintain an understanding of the internal architecture and client requirements to our applications
  • Manage the processes of deployments using blue-green deployment pattern whenever possible
  • Implement the tools and processes for monitoring servers and services
  • Ensure proper backup and restore when a failure occurs
  • Suggest ways to improve and reduce operational costs with adaptive performance tuning
  • Investigate and develop skills in new technologies, collaborate across the company
Requirements
  • Ideal applicants should be used to dealing with escalated issues but may or may not have been focused solely on docker/Kubernetes support.
  • The candidate with a minimum of 3-5 years' experience with a broad IT support background, covering Docker, Kubernetes, Infrastructure experience on server and networking and some development experience. I'm particularly interested in experience of the following:
  • At least 3 years of experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and/or cloud deployment technologies or college fresh graduate with IT background
  • Operations or systems administration experience, particularly on Linux
  • He/she requires a broad knowledge of systems, servers, load balancers, storages, security, networking and some background in programming.
  • Experience with container networking on Docker & Kubernetes
  • Strong experience in managing high-load and auto-scaling production environment
  • Programming experience in any scripting language (like Python)
  • Experience on Machine Learning domain will be add-on
  • Application support experience will be add-on
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column1:
","
SVP, Public Cloud Software Engineer Technical Lead, Technology & Operations - (WD26123)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. The role is for an experienced hands-on full stack developer that has either fundamental understanding or a deep interest in public cloud or experience with infrastructure automation and portal development. A deeply experienced software developer that has intimate knowledge of the nuances of multiple languages and frameworks with very good mentorship and team development abilities. The product portfolio includes portals and associated backends that deliver:
  • Multi cloud application onboarding 
  • Public cloud Deployment management and visibility
  • Compliance, operations, security, and cost governance visibility 
  • Automated infrastructure intervention workflows
  • Firewall and policy automation portals
  • Other public cloud management related functionality as required 
Responsibilities
  • Lead, mentor and contribute to direct execution of software development
  • This is a hands-on role where the developer lead by example earns the trust and respect of the team by delivering functionality and tending to operational exigencies that may arise
  • Code development, product strategy and integration with the DBS public cloud deployment pipeline and the public cloud services
  • Advocate for the customers via the implementation of easy to use features and healthy roadmap to solve real customer problems
  • Mentor on design process, instil SRE philosophy into development practices
  • Develop web application using technologies such as Angular, Java / Spring core and docker to be deployed on AWS & Google Cloud, using microservices as the software architecture pattern with freedom to choose the technology for each problem. e.g EKS, ECS, Lambda, API gateway or, load balanced EC2.
  • Ensure secure coding and existing software development lifecycle guidelines and standards are met
  • Participate in daily agile stand up scrum meeting and sprint planning and prioritization
Requirements
  • Proven recent experience in multi-tiered application development, and familiarity with design considerations such as Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), performance, scalability, re-usability and flexibility 
  • 8+ years experience in designing and developing web applications and solutions that are lightweight, responsive, and user-friendly
  • 5+ years of hands-on enterprise-level recent web development on any of the following: Angular, JavaScript, React, Vue or similar
  • 5+ years of professional enterprise software development experience of in any of the following: Java, Spring ,Python, Node, Go, C/C++
  • Command of web technology fundamentals HTTP, Websockets, Content Distribution, WAF, REST, JSON, YAML, CORS, Session/ cookies, SAML, OAuth
  • Production experience and general knowledge of common persistent stores such as SQL, DynamoDB, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Redis
  • General knowledge of infrastructure components, TCP/IP, DNS, ICMP, PKI, TLS
  • Good knowledge In Architectural Pattern such as MVC, DAO, and Design Patterns such as AOP, Facade, Factory, Singleton, etc.
  • Knowledge in Test Driven Development and Test Automation using GIT, Maven and best CI/CD practices Junit, Protractor, Selenium, etc.
  • Experience working under Agile methodology
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.  
",[],Senior Manager,,5 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Medical', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)']",https://ars2.equest.com/?response_id=d5a05a1e19476da9f083b150eea06804,70000,Singapore,sg

Responsibilities:
  • Deliver stable, efficient, and reliable Cloud Infrastructure and operations.
  • Support implementation and testing of installation of Cloud Infrastructure.
  • Write and maintain custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human intervention time on any tasks. (Infrastructure as code, AWS CloudFormation).
  • Perform daily performance monitoring, analysis, and maintenance to ensure system Cloud Infrastructure performed.
  • Support Cloud Infrastructure Operations, resolve Cloud Infrastructure incidents.
  • Diagnose problem source through discussions with users.
  • Escalate problems or issues to higher management.
  • Support implementation of preventive measures, planned maintenance events, system backup processes and disaster recovery drills.
  • Support reports on performance and availability of Cloud Infrastructure systems by reviewing of service uptime, utilization, and throughput.

Requirements:
  • Bachelor`s degree in technical, Polytechnic diploma in technical or equivalent experience.
  • It is important that they have relevant cloud certifications such as AWS Cloud Practitioner or Sys Ops .
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker , Kubernetes Docker and EKS. and Public cloud delivery know-how with AWS and/or Azure
  • Hands-on AWS experience with at least 1 implementation
  • Familiar with one of the enterprise operating systems (Microsoft Windows Server (20012 & up) and/or RHEL 7, 8)
  • Competent and having a sound knowledge (Configure and troubleshoot) of various network protocols and topologies, including a broad knowledge of WLAN, switches, routers, servers, IPS/IDS and firewalls

The Cloud Operations Lead will be leading an operation team consisting of three tracks : System Admin, CI/CD and Endpoint Administration. Each track may have an estimated 3-4 engineers (total 12 engineers).The Cloud Operations Lead will be the technical leader sharing best practices, processes and methodologies for the three teams. The Cloud Operations Lead is a hands-on role who is both a leader and individual contributor. Activities for the team will include managing change requests, investigating issues / events / incidents, mitigating vulnerabilities and deploying patches.The Cloud Operations Lead is an expert in AWS cloud and well versed with ITIL operational processes in AWS cloud. You feel ready to take on an appointment to oversee and lead junior engineers by example, bringing best practices for managing cloud infrastructure and applications and ensuring service level agreements with customer are addressed in a timely manner.Responsibilities:
  • Technical ownership for 3 tracks : System Admin, CI/CD and Endpoint Administration
  • Involved in exploring, designing and configuring workloads, PaaS, IaaS and other AWS subsystems for customer
  • Main interface to customer for technical issues
  • Coaching and guiding the team of engineers from 3 different tracks
  • Driving team towards operational excellence
  • Assigning, delegating and managing the workload of team members
  • Manage team operations for security, vulnerabilities and patch management
  • Address daily events, tasks, incidents, and problems
  • Lead and engage in discussions with Cloud Service Providers, OEM and principals
Requirements:
  • Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related disciplines
  • At least 10 years working experience with 5 years in AWS cloud
  • AWS SysOps Administrator Associate or equivalent
  • Terraform Associate or equivalent
  • Knowledge of Windows OSes and Linux
  • Knowledge of security tools such as SonarQube, Tenable, WebInspect, Nexus IQ
  • Configuration Management Tools such as Ansible and Puppet
  • CI/CD tools and processes such as Bamboo, Jira, Bitbucket, Digital.ai
  • Familiar with enterprise IT environments with strong governance and security requirements

CTC Global Pte Ltd is a wholly-owned subsidiary of ITOCHU Techno-Solutions Corporation (CTC) and ITOCHU Corporation. ITOCHU Corporation is one of the largest conglomerates in Japan and is the majority shareholder of CTC. Both CTC and ITOCHU Corporation are listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange, and have current market capitalisations of US$2.6 billion and US$18.6 billion respectively.

In Singapore, the CTC Global team has been serving enterprise customers from major commercial and government sectors for over 40 years, starting from when it was CSA, then subsequently CSC and now as part of the CTC and ITOCHU Group.

Powered by a team of 200 qualified and experienced IT professionals and leveraging on its partnerships with today's most innovative IT corporations worldwide, CTC Global delivers an extensive portfolio of systems integration solutions to enable businesses to operate more efficiently.
","

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for working with customers and project managers for installation, configuration & troubleshooting of various Linux operating systems, design and implement solutions on Cloud
  • RedHat Enterprise Linux administration, Server provisioning, patching, security hardening, vulnerability remediation, performance tuning
  • Implementation and management of High Availability RedHat Cluster servers with GFS, SuSE high availability clusters (or) Veritas Clusters
  • System Integration of servers, provide support for Linux Servers ranging from HP, IBM, Dell & Oracle
  • Deployment and configurations on Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform and Kubernetes architecture and administration across all working components
  • Deployment and configurations of RedHat Ansible Engine & Ansible Tower, including designing and deployment of playbooks
  • Preparing project documentation for customer for new installations, upgrades, and deployments

Requirements

  • Minimum 5 years of strong technical expertise in various Unix based Operating Systems (either 2):
  1. Redhat (mandatory)
  2. Suse
  3. CentOS
  4. Solaris
  • Familiar working with Virtualized environment: Vmware, HyperV, KVM
  • Experienced in PXE boot, repo server, Red hat Satellite infrastructure management
  • Technical expertise in Container Orchestration: Apache, Nagios, Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, RedHat Linux 7 and above
  • Excellent knowledge and understanding in DevOps process, including use of git, Jira, bitbucket and CI/CD pipelines
  • Good knowledge in deploying and configuring automation tools / IaC: Chef, Ansible, Terraform (Certification preferred), playbook creation
  • Expertise in at least one scripting or programming language (Bash, Shell-scripting, PHP, Java, Ruby, Python, etc.)
  • Experienced working in cloud infrastructure roles (AWS / Azure / Google/ ManageIQ/ CloudForms)
  • Good understanding of networking and security knowledge (WAN / LAN concepts , the TCP/IP protocol stack, network routing and firewall, micro segmentation)
  • Broad exposure to a variety of other technologies (e.g. Active Directory, DNS, and Group Policy technologies, middleware such as Websphere/ Weblogic/ OHS, backup and recovery procedures using backup tools for e.g. NetBackup) with a strong infra troubleshooting skills
  • Self-motivated with a positive “can-do” attitude, passionate on problem solving and willingness in picking up new skillsets

Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Job purpose
The engineer is required to perform the role to maintain/review/enhance the bank's network security policies and governance, audit management and compliance.
Key accountabilities
  • Accountable for network audit and compliance activities, facilitating audits and compliance reviews and overseeing all required regulatory and audit remediation activities. 
  • Accountable for ensuring the network security governance
  • Accountable for working with LOBs and Infrastructure teams in the bank on network security requirements and compliance.
Job Duties & Responsibilities
  • Audit management responsibilities focus on facilitating all manner of network audits and is required to interact with various audit bodies including internal and external auditors, and industry or government regulators.
  • Ensure that all network security policies (ISCD, health check, APAR), audit compliance documentation and artefacts are properly documented and readily available.
  • Perform analysis, and response to network security events.
  • Review and Provide risk assessment for Firewall, Proxy and NAC whitelisting requests.
  • Performs independent analysis to identify, highlight and document network information security issues and risks. Follows-up on action items through to closure of issues and facilitates feedback (e.g. Report, plan, track, support remediation and verify discovered security issues).
Requirements
  • Highly motivated, and always positive with ability to work with minimal supervision.
  • Excellent communication skills, fluent in English (written/verbal).
  • String analytical and problem-solving skills is mandatory.
  • Excellent Team player as well as ability to work independently.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and keep pace with technical/operational innovation.Experience in liaising with Auditors as well as having risk management background in a financial organization is highly advantageous.
  • Degree in computer science, networking, engineering, or other computer-related field of study.
  • CISSP certification and other Security+, CASP, CISM, CEH, GIAC, GCIH would be an advantage.
  • Solid understanding of a networking technologies and concepts within a large organization is required.
  • Experience with various network security tools is an advantage
  • Good understanding of scripting (various OS environments) and major programming languages is advantageous.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column1:
","
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Cloud Engineering and Services is a diverse team focused on modernizing DBS’ technology delivery methods and platforms to enable the bank to compete in the Digital Economy on Cloud. Our vision is to enable teams to deliver concept to cash in record time, with no customer disruption and no operations. Inspired by the GAFA and Fintech companies, as well as other emerging technologies,we develop enterprise grade solutions for consumption by business and technology units.
About the Role
Mid experience software engineer to work in the DBS public cloud team to develop application which helps DevOps teams consume, track and report all public cloud application deployment, lifecycle and governance aspects.
The role will be required to implement key code against existing specifications and requirements in compliance with existing organisational standards. The role is for a junior to mid full stack developer that has either fundamental understanding or a deep interest in public cloud or experience with infrastructure automation and portal development, not afraid of existing code bases and pick up new skills as needed.
Responsibilities
  • Code development, integration and troubleshooting during development and integration with the DBS public cloud deployment pipeline and the public cloud services to enable application teams go live within target deadlines.
  • Deliver assigned features and tasks with high quality and timeliness.
  • Design, build and implement web applications based on specification and work with different stakeholders to ensure successful software release
  • Develop web application using technologies such as Angular 9+, Java / Spring core and docker to be deployed on AWS & Google Cloud, using microservices as the software architecture pattern with freedom to choose the technology for each problem. e.g EKS, ECS, Lambda, API gateway or, load balanced EC2.
  • Ensure secure coding and existing software development lifecycle guidelines and standards are met
  • Participate in daily agile stand up scrum meeting and sprint planning
  • Write unit test and execute unit testing and assist in user acceptance testing
Key Skills and Experience
  • > 3 years of working experience in the IT industry.
  • 3+ years experience in designing and developing web applications and solutions that are lightweight, responsive and user-friendly
  • 3+ years of hands-on enterprise-level web development on any of the following: Angular 5+, JavaScript, React, Vue
  • 3+ years of professional enterprise software development experience of in any of the following: Java, Spring ,Python, Node, Go
  • Command of web technology fundamentals HTTP, Websockets, Content Distribution, WAF, REST, JSON, YAML, CORS, Session/ cookies, SAML, OAtuh
  • Production experience of common persistent stores such as SQL, DynamoDB, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Redis
  • General knowledge of infrastructure components, TCP/IP, DNS, ICMP, PKI, TLS
  • Good knowledge In Architectural Pattern such as MVC, DAO, and Design Patterns such as AOP, Facade, Factory, Singleton, etc.
  • Knowledge in Test Driven Development and Test Automation using GIT, Maven and best CI/CD practices Junit, Protractor, Selenium, etc.
  • Knowledge of any of the following in enterprise security aware setting: K8S, Ansible, Terraform, CloudFormation, Jenkins, Bamboo, Pulumi
  • Experience working under Agile methodology
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
SVP, Public Cloud Software Engineer Technical Lead, Technology & Operations - (WD26123)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. The role is for an experienced hands-on full stack developer that has either fundamental understanding or a deep interest in public cloud or experience with infrastructure automation and portal development. A deeply experienced software developer that has intimate knowledge of the nuances of multiple languages and frameworks with very good mentorship and team development abilities. The product portfolio includes portals and associated backends that deliver:
  • Multi cloud application onboarding 
  • Public cloud Deployment management and visibility
  • Compliance, operations, security, and cost governance visibility 
  • Automated infrastructure intervention workflows
  • Firewall and policy automation portals
  • Other public cloud management related functionality as required 
Responsibilities
  • Lead, mentor and contribute to direct execution of software development
  • This is a hands-on role where the developer lead by example earns the trust and respect of the team by delivering functionality and tending to operational exigencies that may arise
  • Code development, product strategy and integration with the DBS public cloud deployment pipeline and the public cloud services
  • Advocate for the customers via the implementation of easy to use features and healthy roadmap to solve real customer problems
  • Mentor on design process, instil SRE philosophy into development practices
  • Develop web application using technologies such as Angular, Java / Spring core and docker to be deployed on AWS & Google Cloud, using microservices as the software architecture pattern with freedom to choose the technology for each problem. e.g EKS, ECS, Lambda, API gateway or, load balanced EC2.
  • Ensure secure coding and existing software development lifecycle guidelines and standards are met
  • Participate in daily agile stand up scrum meeting and sprint planning and prioritization
Requirements
  • Proven recent experience in multi-tiered application development, and familiarity with design considerations such as Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), performance, scalability, re-usability and flexibility 
  • 8+ years experience in designing and developing web applications and solutions that are lightweight, responsive, and user-friendly
  • 5+ years of hands-on enterprise-level recent web development on any of the following: Angular, JavaScript, React, Vue or similar
  • 5+ years of professional enterprise software development experience of in any of the following: Java, Spring ,Python, Node, Go, C/C++
  • Command of web technology fundamentals HTTP, Websockets, Content Distribution, WAF, REST, JSON, YAML, CORS, Session/ cookies, SAML, OAuth
  • Production experience and general knowledge of common persistent stores such as SQL, DynamoDB, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Redis
  • General knowledge of infrastructure components, TCP/IP, DNS, ICMP, PKI, TLS
  • Good knowledge In Architectural Pattern such as MVC, DAO, and Design Patterns such as AOP, Facade, Factory, Singleton, etc.
  • Knowledge in Test Driven Development and Test Automation using GIT, Maven and best CI/CD practices Junit, Protractor, Selenium, etc.
  • Experience working under Agile methodology
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column1: 48,cloud engineer,/en/job/cloud-infrastructure-specialist-ikano-retail-9412914,9412914,"Cloud Infrastructure Specialist, Ikano Retail",False,False,,,SGD,Ikano Pte Ltd,25-Mar-22,False,,12 days,198004112M,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div>

column2:
IKEA has a unique company culture - to give people the opportunity to grow, both as individuals and professionally, so that together we can commit to creating a better everyday life for ourselves, and for our customers. Enthusiasm, willingness to accept & delegate responsibility, humility, simplicity, and daring to be different are some of our values that create a greater sense of belonging and togetherness. We don't just want to fill jobs, we want to partner with unique individuals who care more about customers and co-workers, who feel more for our ideas and are prepared to give more of themselves in realising them. ","

Company Description:

The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.

We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.

We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.

Job Description:

About the job

Reporting to IT Infra & Operations Manager, this role plays an important part in delivering Cloud infrastructure and Security services that supports business growth and operational excellence with common operating model across the region incl. IKEA Stores, Shopping Centers and Services Office.

Your assignment

  • Lead the long-term planning, design, implementation and support of existing cloud infrastructure & new initiatives at regional level with due diligence and considerations for the future needs of the organisation, ensuring adherence to policies and procedures in relation to network growth, security and upgrades on proactive basis.
  • Recommend, plan, implement and support tools & capabilities based on review, analyse of the current environment and knowledge of various on-premises, cloud-based, and hybrid resources specifically on Microsoft Azure
  • Working knowledge of Cloud Infrastructure standards (MS Azure), IT policies, procedures and familiarity with the development and deployment of various standards & regularly evaluate cloud applications & infra to Implement a secure, environment to support IT Operations.
  • Analyses proposed system changes to identify strategies for meeting business objectives and impacts, including benefits, costs and effort required to implement. Collaborate with IT, super users, vendor teams as needed.
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge by researching new technologies and software products
  • Develop in house competence & knowledge transfer to IT team on cloud infrastructure methodologies & processes.

Your profile

  • Degree or recognized equivalent, preferably in Computer Science or related field, from an accredited university or comparable on-the-job experience with Microsoft Azure architecture & administrations certifications.
  • 5+ years of experience in implementing, administering and support on-prem & Cloud infrastructure (i.e. AD, servers, upgrades and implementations, VMWARE, Cisco Network, Firewall, EUC Security, IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, Cloud security and monitoring)
  • Hands-on experience in the administration of Azure infrastructure, including but not limited to virtualization, tag-ging, vnets, vnet gateways, Azure backup, storage accounts, load balancers, NSGs, WAF and event security logging.
  • Good knowledge and experience in Cloud infra architect role, leading IT initiatives and supporting complex Cloud infrastructure technologies at large enterprise level with Advanced troubleshooting and problem-solving experi-ence.
  • Work as a subject matter expert for Cloud infrastructure solutions with experience in Cloud technologies, IT systems, network & security solution and service delivery management.
  • Must have good knowledge on Unified log management system (SIEM/Azure Sentinel etc.), Cloud infra Monitoring system IT security management – Servers, Network devices, Azure Cloud and End user computing/IoT
  • Review and optimize Azure consumption & costing to business projects & units.
  • Service oriented and self-driven. Able to work with flexible hours and travel regionally.

Additional Information

Please apply by 8 April 2022.

ACLOUD PTE LTD

We are a Microsoft Certified Gold Partner who offers Enterprise Consulting Services, IT Planning & Solutions, Solution Implementation, Managed Services and Support. We specialize in Microsoft cloud computing, datacentre management, business productivity, cloud security and governance, identity access and mobility management.

Our Mission

ACLOUD offers business solution that communicating business needs, people and technologies. We leverage our skills in Information Technology to help streamline the business and people process. We are here to guide & empower our customers on their cloud transformation journey

We are a trusted partner to help our customers build a cloud that will fit their needs – and help them keep it running efficiently and effectively. We listen to their needs, adapt our services to meet them, and often go above and beyond.

Our Values

Reliability - We're here for you yesterday, today and tomorrow. We take pride in providing excellent services and after-sales support to our customers

Diversity - We are a team of technology consultants who come from different backgrounds, bringing diverse experience from different industries.

Innovation - We admire those who are able to think of new ways to empower and improve lives. Similarly, we leverage on technology in different ways to achieve different objectives for our customers

Transparency - We build trust by being honest and transparent in our relationships with customers, colleagues and partners.

For more information, visit our website:

https://acloud.com.sg/

","

We are actively seeking someone who loves technology to join our team in creating and enhancing our technical team. It is our mission to help organizations adopt, leverage, secure and innovate in the cloud. Our ideal candidate is someone who is passionate about the technology (any technology is welcomed eg; cloud, iot, automation, someone who loves challenges and someone who believes in creating value in what they do).

For this role, a Technical Consultant responsibilities include solution architecting, management, delivery and technical support according to project/ customer needs.

Job Roles:

  • Understanding of on-premise and cloud computing technologies.(Microsoft Preferred)
  • Good understanding of Microsoft Azure Ecosystems
  • Good understanding of Microsoft 365 Ecosystems
  • Understanding in the following products/ areas (any areas): Active Directory, Office 365, Microsoft 365, Enterprise Mobility Suite, Azure Ecosystem, Windows Server, cloud security, ITIL will be great!
  • Nice to haves: Experience supporting applications running on either Amazon AWS or MS Azure, Experience with virtualization solutions (vmware, docker, virtualbox, etc), Microsoft Exchange, Hyper-V, System Center,network, SQL.
  • Good understanding of the technical fundamentals of the Internet. You should have sufficient knowledge of internet protocols such as TCP/IP, HTTP/S, FTP, DNS as well as the ability to use diagnostic tools to troubleshoot connectivity issues
  • Scripting/coding experience In any of the following is a good to have: Powershell, Java, python
  • Experience in removing technology blockers in a matrix organization and so enabling the customer’s business
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail

Job Requirements:

  • Strong Customer Advocacy skills
  • Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal
  • Strong troubleshooting skills to logically go about solving problems
  • Subject Matter Expertise in one or more technical area(s)
  • Able to present comfortably in front of customers
  • Strong teaming skills in a highly collaborative environment
  • Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's Degree/Post Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in Engineering (Computer/Telecommunication) or equivalent.
  • Required language(s): English
  • University/polytechnic entry level candidates are encouraged to apply

• Freshers are encouraged to apply!

• Junior engineers are welcome to apply!

• Must be based in Singapore

* Salary offering will be based on your experience

Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading IT solution and service provider headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency. 

We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation.

We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team. 

If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you.

What will you do?

  • Incorporate as best practice, continuous improvement process in cloud deployment through monitoring, reporting, evaluating, and improving the cost to performance ratio.
  • As part of a team of cloud infrastructure engineers to ensure smooth operations and within the budgeted cost and operational expenses.
  • Engage, design and deliver the cloud operation services to customers in accordance with the tender specifications and proposed solutions.
  • Diploma/bachelor’s degree in computer information systems or related field.

  • Knowledge of tools to automate the deployment and management of containerized applications (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)

What are we looking for?

  • 3+ years experience with Linux or Windows Server OS
  • Knowledge of Jira, agile PM, and the ability to work independently and professionally.
  • AWS Solutions Architect or AWS SysOps Administrator Certification will be advantageous.

Addressing challenging data pipeline and engineering problems by discovering information hidden in vast amount of data by leveraging techniques in statistics, machine learning, and data mining. The data scientist will work closely with the business users, project managers, and database engineers to develop sophisticated analytics algorithms that provide actionable insights. The role requires to a trusted adviser to our clients in conceptualizing advanced analytics solutions and enabling their journey in data science.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Work closely with clients from various domains to gather requirements and translate those to suitable technical designs.
  • Dive into company data to identify sources and features that will drive business objectives.
  • Design data infrastructures architecture for ingestion of real-time and batch data streaming using cloud native services
  • Work in interdisciplinary teams that combine technical, business and data science competencies that deliver work in waterfall or agile software development lifecycle methodologies.
  • Architect, Design and Build the applications and its CICD pipelines using cloud services.
  • Investigate all reported problems/errors & initiate amendments & testing so that the system can operate correctly & efficiently. 
  • Deploy and monitor Machine Learning Models in production environment.
  • Develop and monitor REST API end points for Machine Learning Models deployment.
  • Develop analytics dashboards and communicate its findings using PowerBI/Tableau.
  • Setup and monitor cloud infrastructure's security and network settings.
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Degree / Masters in Information Technology, Computer Science or Engineering, Information Systems or equivalent discipline
  • Have strong technical background in Python development.
  • Minimum 4 years experience in using cloud native data lake, ETL, data warehouse and databases services such as DataBricks, Snowflakes, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Sypnase, AWS S3, AWS RedShift, AWS Kinesis, AWS QuickSight,  etc.
  • Experience in developing analytics dashboard using PowerBI/Tableau.
  • Experience in deploying Machine Learning Models using Docker/Kubernetes into production.
  • Experience with model deployment and operationalization (eg KubeFlow).
  • Experience with Python programming, Apache Spark (or PySpark) coding capability to operationalize data analytics workflows & processes
  • Experience in developing API end points using Web Framework like Django or cloud serverless services like AWS API Gateway and AWS Lambda.
  • Experience in setup CI/CD pipeline and familiar with the DevOps tools like Azure DevOps, Travis CI, Ansible, etc.
  • Strong working knowledge in Linux and shell scripting.
  • Only Singaporeans
Please contact Ranelle Liew at +65 9836 1864 or RanelleL@charterhouse.com.sg for a confidential discussion

column1: 53,cloud engineer,/en/job/cloud-team-lead-9312379,9312379,Cloud Team Lead,False,False,,,SGD,ECLOUDVALLEY TECHNOLOGY PTE. LTD.,22-Mar-22,False,,5 days,201911448G,,,201 - 500 Employees,,Clarke Quay,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">
<div>

Founded in 2014 as a born-in-the-cloud partner focused entirely on AWS services, eCloudvalley has grown to 380+ employees with geographic footprints across APAC region, in Taiwan, Hong Kong, China, Philippines, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, and United States. eCloudvalley is the notable vendor in the Asia Pacific regional contextualization of the Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud infrastructure MSP on Gartner.

With a mission to evolve the customer’s business with cloud technology, eCloudvalley has built a professional technical team with over 500 AWS certifications and has served 1,000 enterprises to perform any digital transformation. Our core competencies include Cloud Migration, Managed Services Provider, Data Solution, SAP, DB Freedom, Cloud Training, DevOps, Serverless, and Containers.

Our business has been growing and expanding rapidly and we are looking for new talents to join us. If you are a person with entrepreneur mindset and would like to be a part to disrupt the market, you may be one of the people that we need!
","

Do you like helping enterprise clients implement innovative cloud solutions and solve technical problems? Do you want to be a leader and demonstrate how emerging technologies (such as A.I., Big Data, Cloud, DevOps) can be applied to businesses?

With business growth and global expansion opportunities, we are looking for a highly motivated Service Delivery Manager to help accelerate our growing team. This is an excellent opportunity to join a world-class team, working with some of the best and brightest engineers and account managers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Earn a Trusted Client Advisory relationship with our clients and team.
  • Work with customers to provide visibility and guidance around their AWS Services account through regular Operational Service Reviews and Reporting.
  • Be involved in the change management process of the customer’s environment to ensure success and service up-time.
  • Work with application owners to develop and standardize test, upgrade, and release management processes.
  • Engage with Director and C-Level executives to understand business needs.
  • Go “toe to toe” with customer technical stakeholders on most issues.
  • Be the voice of the customer and work with AWS resources to ensure that the customer’s SLA’s are met.
  • Participate in customer-requested meetings (onsite or via phone).
  • Provide oversight of escalation, prioritization, and drive customer communication during critical events.
  • Assist in the Design/Architecture of AWS cloud solutions.
  • Establish a working relationship with other AWS account team members such as Technical Account Managers, Business Development Managers, and others to achieve the best result for the customer.
  • Be available outside of business hours to help coordinate the handling of urgent issues as needed.

Basic Qualifications

  • At least 3+ years of experience working in a customer-facing technical service delivery or support role (design, implementation, consulting, infrastructure, and/or cloud service system administration).
  • 1+ years of experience in cloud services support (e.g. cloud service provider, managed service engineering delivery of scale, tier 3 cloud support).
  • Client Communication and Presentation experience (public speaking, creation of content such as whitepapers, presentations, project plans, or other written deliverables).
  • Technical complex troubleshooting skills in infrastructure services (OS, networking, cloud).

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in managed service delivery management.
  • Experience with virtualization, distributed networks, and/or cloud computing of scale.
  • Experience with virtualization technologies (Hypervisors, VMware, and Xen).
  • Consulting experience for a Cloud Service Provider.
  • Previous or current experience in an engineering support technical role (systems or network administration/operations or similar).
  • Knowledge of networking protocols such as HTTP, DNS, and TCP/IP.
  • Experience with AWS service offerings.
  • Experience in Service Level Reviews, Reporting, and Management.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects in a fast-moving environment.
  • High level of comfort communicating effectively across internal and external organizations.

Certis is a leading advanced integrated security organisation that develops and delivers multi-disciplinary security and integrated services. Our design-for-purpose solutions are led by an extensive track record of running operations and design thinking to drive operational efficiencies and deliver business-critical outcomes for our customers. Headquartered in Singapore, our international presence that extends to Australia, Hong Kong, Macau, China and the Middle East.","
About Certis

We are a leading security services organisation. We put technology to work in making the world a safer place. Our mission is that as trusted partners, we protect lives and assets, and deliver integrated critical services. By empowering our people, our goal is to enable our communities to stay safe and thriving.

We offer a broad range of opportunities and career pathways for our people to grow and explore their potential. We believe that people, equipped with innovative thinking and technological capabilities will make the world safer, smarter and better.

Life at Certis

If you are a passionate individual looking for opportunities to expand your skills, and purposeful work instead of just a 'job', we would love to hear from you.

At Certis, no two days look alike. Our work calendars are filled with chances to collaborate with others, and bring new initiatives to life. Whether you're looking to improve a process, or have an innovative idea awaiting a technology solve, we want you to bring your ideas to the table.

We are a close-knit team that looks out for each other, works hard to get the job done, and encourages each other to grow - the perfect place for you to grow your career!

Duties & Responsibilities
  • To maintain and support the critical Corporate system to ensure high system availability for the Corporate services
  • Responsible for the monitoring of the critical system availability and performance and to respond in the event of any operation and security incident related to the Corporate system
  • To review and analyse Corporate system performance and advise on Corporate system performance tuning and improvement
  • To work closely with a team of engineers to ensure the day-to-day operations of the core cloud infrastructure
  • Perform the day-to-day activities (system monitoring, availability of servers, reviewing of logs, verifying completion of jobs) of the UAT & Production deployments in data centers and on the cloud
  • Apply OS patches, security patches and upgrades on a regular basis
  • Install, configure, and maintain environments across stages (Dev, Test, Prod)
  • Maintain OS, database, middleware and software updates current across servers
  • To engage users to understand their IT needs, design and lead improvement projects to achieve the operational KPI/SLA. This includes needs within the Teams to improve day-to-day operations
  • To liaise and manage 3rd party vendors/supplier to ensure all contractual obligations are fulfilled, which include price negotiation and definition of scope of work
  • To perform vendor assessments to determine the compliance readiness and capability of vendors to ensure the most suitable vendor is chosen for the correct job
  • To assist with internal and external auditors for all audits and certifications
  • To maintain proper documentation of IT inventory and develop IT processes and standards
  • To serve as backup role for some of the team functions including database administrator, system administrator, etc
  • Understanding and driving prioritized tasks based on department and company goals
  • The candidate will be required to be on standby with on-call availability including nights, weekends and holidays.
Skills & Experience

Recognition & Reward

What you can expect from us:

  • Work on projects for world-class security projects renowned for their safety, reliability and efficiency
  • Commitment to your ongoing development, including on-the-job opportunities, formal programs and assistance with further education
  • Community volunteering opportunities
  • A competitive remuneration package, featuring performance-based incentives and a medical insurance and dental allowance.
  • Certis is committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workforce culture, which is supported by our Compass values. Our aim is to attract, develop and retain a truly diverse and high-performing workforce.

Reporting to the Assistant Vice President of Architecture, this role sits in the Technology Solutions department and will focus on the implementation, support, and maintenance of cloud computing for our business units in Asia.

About the Role 
Responsibilities:
Automate and containerize all the existing and new service in ATLAS into an micro service and deploy in open shift platform.

Skillset (Must have)﻿﻿
  • Expertise in App Containerization technology Docker, creating Docker images, Containers, Docker Registry to store images, cloud-based registry Docker Hub, Docker Swarm to manage containers.
  • Experience in deployment automation of all the Microservices to pull the image from the private Docker Registry and deployed into Docker Swarm to create a complete docker cluster by using Ansible.
  • Experience in managing Kubernetes charts using Helm. Creating reproducible builds of the Kubernetes applications, managed manifest files and releases of Helm packages. Created Pods in Kubernetes and monitored the health of pods using Helm charts.
  • Experience in working on NoSQL database MongoDB to Replica setup and sharing, and managing Replica set.
Skillset (Good to have)
  • Experience in implementing CI/CD for Micro services Architecture Environment (NodeJS, .Net Core, Zookeeper, Kafka, Redis ) using Jenkins, Anthill Pro and UDeploy.
  • Experience in using Jenkins with SonarQube to analzse and get the better quality of the source code.
  • Experience in working with RedHat OpenShift Container Platform for Docker and Kubernetes, using Kubernetes to manage containerized applications with its nodes, ConfigMaps, node-selector, Services and deployed application containers as Pods.
  • Expertise in LINUX / UNIX system builds, administration, installations, upgrades, troubleshooting on different distributions such as Ubuntu, CentOS, RHEL 5.x/6.X/7. X. Expertise in creating Exception Group policies for Windows Server 2003/2008/2012R2 in AD domain.

Job Description:
  • Work closely with public cloud and managed service providers to deliver the projects requested from internal business units.
  • Clarify cloud requirements with internal business units, provide solution architecture and cost estimation, implement the solution after budget approval.
  • Manage and monitor cloud accounts from a technical perspective, performance monitoring and operations on cloud infrastructure across the region.
  • Process internal trouble tickets, provide 2nd level escalation support to troubleshoot and solve challenging operational issues in a complex environment.
  • Build and maintain the inventory of cloud resources through cloud API.
  • Liaise with providers and internal business units for problem resolution and best practices.
Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or a related subject.
  • Proven working experience in cloud operations or as a DevOps Engineer, with a strong customer focus.
  • Solid skill set on UNIX/LINUX system, including hands-on experience in system configuration and troubleshooting. Being RHCSA/RHCE certified is a plus.
  • Solid experience with one or more public cloud environments such as GCP, AWS, Tencent Cloud, Alibaba Cloud, etc.
  • Good understanding in networking and routing fundamentals, common network equipment, network protocols and network operations & maintenance.
  • Hands on experience with VMware, OpenStack or other Open source technologies;
  • Hands on experience in container management and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes. Familiarity with GKE is a big plus.
  • Familiar with Terraform/Ansible, Python/Go programming knowledge is a plus.
  • Solid understanding on cloud security.
You may email your resume to hazel@alignrecruitment.com.sg for more information.
Regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by our consultants.

column3: At ST Engineering, our purpose is to apply our technology and innovation to solve real-world problems and improve lives. Our dedication to excellence and our strong track record have earned us a distinctive reputation for quality and trust as a global technology, defence and engineering group. Our diverse portfolio of businesses spans the aerospace, smart city, defence and public security segments.

We succeed because of our ability to deliver what our partners and customers need. Together, we transform and future-proof cities to make them more mobile, more secure and more liveable for communities. With our expertise and facilities around the world, we keep aircraft flying safely and seagoing vessels operating efficiently.

We help nations protect their citizens by meeting their air, land and sea defence needs and equipping their fighting forces to perform on the battlefield. Our cybersecurity and critical systems help our customers enforce public and homeland security in an increasingly digital world. And our satellite communications equipment contribute to much of the world’s network connectivity.

","
Profile: Technical Lead (Cloud & DevSecOps Architect)
Responsibilities:
  • Understand the hybrid cloud design, service availability
  • Engage business users or IT stakeholders to understand the runtime / deployment needs of a business application (COTS / in-house developed)
  • Assess the business, technical, cyber-security and data profile of an application
  • Review or advise target architecture, complying to best practices and cyber-security guidelines
  • Engage IT teams to co-ordinate deployments and cost optimization of the infrastructure
  • Design and implement a framework for application on-boarding, periodic review and governance model
  • Setup, configure and maintain plan/code/build tools leveraging Azure DevOps (ADO) in a hybrid cloud
  • Setup, configure and maintain SCA, SAST, DAST and VAPT tool chains and integrate to ADO ecosystem
  • Setup, configure and maintain Infrastructure and configuration management tools and integrate to ADO ecosystem
  • Setup, configure and maintain automated and manual testing tools covering functional testing, performance/load testing and API testing and integrate to ADO
  • Setup, configure and maintain monitoring stack and integrate with ADO and ServiceNow
  • Configure reusable Master pipelines for each tech stack
  • Govern and control access to DevSecOps platform
  • Extend DevSecOps platform as a service to internal stakeholders
Required Technical Skills:
  • Minimum 5 years of work experience in DevSecOps tool chains leveraging Azure DevOps and AWS cloud architecture
  • Strong hands-on expertise in Azure DevOps Server & Service (Azure Boards, Repos, Test Plans, Pipelines, Artifacts, Registry)
  • Strong hands-on expertise in Ansible Tower and proficient in writing IaC (compute, network, storage) using playbooks
  • Strong hands-on expertise in Elastic Stack and its integration to ADO and ServiceNow
  • Strong hands-on expertise in testing tools like Katalon/Selenium, JMeter
  • Strong hands-on expertise in SonarQube/Fortify for SAST, DAST etc.
  • Proficient in writing pipelines as code for Spring JAVA, .NET, MEAN and PHP/Joomla tech stack
  • Proficient in Cloud Native Development principles.
  • Strong expertise in hybrid-cloud / multi-cloud environment
  • Strong hands-on expertise in architecting an application infrastructure in AWS
  • Proficient in design optimization to lower the TCO for an application infrastructure while upholding best practices and cyber security posture
  • Proficient in using AWS services like EC2, RDS, EBS, ALB, TGW, CW, S3 and Lambda
  • Proficient in leveraging AWS APIs to automate data retrieval
Preferred Technical Skills:
  • Knowledge of configuring a pipeline for OutSystems
  • Knowledge of micro-services patterns and architecture
  • Knowledge of RESTful APIs and integration patterns
Soft Skills:
  • Excellent Verbal and Written communication skills
  • Able to communicate with and create relationships between the client and other teams working on the project

The Technical Architect – Cloud & Infrastructure Lead is responsible for the implementation of IT system solutions.  As an Architect, he is also responsible in developing the architectural design based on Cloud architectural principles and best practices; leveraging on Cloud services to ensure infrastructure scalability, reliability, security, and resiliency. Developing the Migration Practices and coordinating with different internal teams and external vendors/partners to ensure successful cloud migration.  The role will be responsible Developing a cloud strategy and coordinating the adaptation process (Messaging services, Office 365….,) and in line with Global Enterprise Technology Services.
Responsibilities
  • Builds, configures, troubleshoots, and manages technologies across the IT infrastructure stack.
  • Competency in writing and maintaining custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower downtime due to required human intervention.
  • Conduct deep dive discussions on Cloud architectural principles, Cloud global infrastructure, network technologies related to Cloud, Security features and tools that Cloud provide and relate to traditional services
  • Data center and server installation, maintenance, monitoring in cloud/IaaS
  • Define improvements for increased system reliability, performance, and capacity management.
  • Review and advise available, cost-efficient, fault-tolerant, and scalable distributed systems on Cloud
  • Review and advise the Cloud network architecture including VPN connectivity between regions and subnets
  • Disaster Recovery and Incident Response Planning
  • Hands on experience on Cloud Infrastructure
  • Maintain, monitor, and support the infrastructure environment and / or facilities.
  • Recommend, implement, and monitor security auditing and alerting solutions. Linux / Windows server installation, maintenance, monitoring, data backup and recovery, security, and administration.
  • Managing networked storage
  • Troubleshoot operational issues, escalate as appropriate, and offer solutions.
  • Validate the environment to meets all security and compliance controls
Qualifications
  • Active Directory design and/or migrations.
  •  AWS/Azure/GCP Certifications preferred.
  • Experience deploying Microsoft Azure and other cloud technologies including Office 365, PAAS, IAAS, SAAS, Power BI, etc.
  • Experience planning and executing Office 365 migrations, specifically Exchange hybrid, cloud, and tenant-to-tenant scenarios
  • Experience with application delivery controllers (e.g., BIG-IP f5) preferred.
  • Experience with Microsoft technologies such as Active Directory, Group Policies, Certificate Services, IIS, etc.
  • General scripting (e.g., PowerShell, VBS) and system automation experience preferred.
  • Hands-on experience with core Microsoft technologies and services, including Azure IaaS, Office 365 and Active Directory, and Windows Server
  • Strong understanding of TCP/IP, LAN, WAN, DHCP, and DNS.
  • Strong working knowledge of security best practices for Microsoft Azure and other cloud-based technologies.
  • Technical expertise in deployment and administration of Virtualization services as related to Hyper-V.
  • Technical expertise in Linux variants: RHEL, OEL, Ubuntu, CentOS
  • Technical expertise in Office 365 Skype for Business, Teams, and Cloud PBX implementation and administration.
  • Technical expertise in Windows Server and Desktop infrastructure, Active Directory services, Networking
  • UNIX/Linux administration experience.
Interested applicants please send me your resume to recruit1@tbs.com.sg.  We thank you for applying with us but only shortlisted candidates will be notified
Fion Karis Woon Yun Shia
Transcendent Business Services

Responsibilities:
  • Automate and containerize all the existing and new service in ATLAS into an micro service and deploy in open shift platform. 

Skillset (Must have)﻿﻿
  • Expertise in App Containerization technology Docker, creating Docker images, Containers, Docker Registry to store images, cloud-based registry Docker Hub, Docker Swarm to manage containers.
  • Experience in deployment automation of all the Microservices to pull the image from the private Docker Registry and deployed into Docker Swarm to create a complete docker cluster by using Ansible.
  • Experience in managing Kubernetes charts using Helm. Creating reproducible builds of the Kubernetes applications, managed manifest files and releases of Helm packages. Created Pods in Kubernetes and monitored the health of pods using Helm charts.
  • Experience in working on NoSQL database MongoDB to Replica setup and sharing, and managing Replica set.

Skillset (Good to have)
  • Experience in implementing CI/CD for Micro services Architecture Environment (NodeJS, .Net Core, Zookeeper, Kafka, Redis ) using Jenkins, Anthill Pro and UDeploy.
  • Experience in using Jenkins with SonarQube to analzse and get the better quality of the source code.
  • Experience in working with RedHat OpenShift Container Platform for Docker and Kubernetes, using Kubernetes to manage containerized applications with its nodes, ConfigMaps, node-selector, Services and deployed application containers as Pods.
  • Expertise in LINUX / UNIX system builds, administration, installations, upgrades, troubleshooting on different distributions such as Ubuntu, CentOS, RHEL 5.x/6.X/7. X. Expertise in creating Exception Group policies for Windows Server 2003/2008/2012R2 in AD domain.

You will be responsible for:

·        The Managed Services and DevOps Solution Architect will be part of a group of technical experts within S&I Infrastructure Technology team. The role serves as the deep Subject Matter Expert (SME) in the development of managed services and DevOps Transformation solutions which includes multi/hybrid cloud design and implementation.

·        This role will work closely with sales teams to provide solution proposal and pre-sales technical support to clients by identifying the client’s requirements and designing a commercially viable IT Infrastructure solution from within the company’s product portfolio.

·        Take a leading role in provide expert technical presales support for opportunities involving managed services and DevOps solution.

·        Work closely with the sales team on early engagement with customer in selling managed services and DevOps solution.

·        Attend meetings with potential clients to understand and gather customer requirements and offer complete & cost-effective solution.

·        Work closely with vendors channel partners, and technology partners to prepare solution write-up, bill of material and engage Service Delivery team for professional effort.

·        Create architecture artefacts and documentation to effectively explain architecture design concepts and solutions to various level of stakeholders.

·        Conduct / Lead in product presentations and demonstrations, and provide support at external and internal customer facing events;

·        Upon contract award; conduct transition/ handover and briefing to project implementation team on the overall solution and design.

·        Lead and manage product demos and POCs;

·        Keep abreast of product technology and certifications. Keep updated of the latest technology and develop technical capability slides.

·        Identify potential and emerging technologies relevant to innovation

Specific Knowledge:

·        You possess a Bachelor in Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineer, Information Technology or related discipline

·        Possess active professional DevOps certifications (AWS / Azure / Google Cloud / industry standard)

·        At least 3 years of experience and strong knowledge in Digital Transformation, Cloud Migration, well-architected Cloud Framework, Day0-1-2-3 Cloud Ops in the market

·        Strong knowledge of Container & Modern technologies (Dockers, Kubernetes, AWS ECS, Google Cloud Anthos)

·        At least 5 years managed services and DevOps experience in building enterprise CI/CD architecture

·        At least 3 years’ experience in designing solutions for deployed environments (Cloud, IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, Backup & DR, etc.) on public clouds solution provider (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)

·        Good knowledge of best practices, system design, continuous integration, continuous delivery, automation and configuration tools, testing, tool integrations

·        Good knowledge of container orchestration, cloud solutions and services in a hybrid cloud environment

·        Customer service oriented, good team player, technically inclined

Required Skills:

·        Possess hands-on experience and good technical skills with proven track records inbuilding enterprise CI/CD architecture such as

   Cloud infrastructure (IaaS/PaaS) such as Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure

   Container technologies like Dockers and Kubernetes.

   Azure, Windows Server and network

·        At least 5 years of experience supporting GitOps / DevOps / DevSecOps

·        Hands-on experience with implementing GitOps using CI/CD tools such as Jenkins and Git

·        Solid experience with PaaS using Red Hat OpenShift, Google Kubernetes Engine or other Kubernetes platforms, and Docker containers

·        Experience with Helm

·        Experience with configuration management tools (Ansible, CloudFormation, Deployment Manager, Terraform)

·        Experience with software development using modern front end technologies, Microservice architecture / RESTful web service, API Management, relational databases, or SQL

·        Experience in Service Mesh technologies such as Istio or OpenShift Service Mesh

·        Knowledge in Big Data, Analytics, Application Modernization, and other edge computing technologies

·        Experience migrating legacy applications to containerized solutions such as OpenShift or Kubernetes

·        Experience with monitoring, scalability, application reliability tools

Required Abilities:

Based in Singapore, with operations in China (including Hong Kong), Botswana and United Arab Emirates, ST Electronics (Info-Software Systems) has an excellent track record of solutions for defence and commercial sectors, and successful partnerships with our customers globally.","
The Cloud Systems Administrator is primarily responsible for the operation and management of a large cloud infrastructure with many of AWS and third-party components. The AWS subscription supports a cloud infrastructure that enables customer workloads to be implemented efficiently and safely. The candidate is expected to be an expert in administering the cloud environment and workloads running in the subscription. Activities will include patch management, software distribution and workload deployment using AWS console and automated scripts to be developed by the candidate.
The candidate will have an in-depth understanding on the workings of AWS and operating systems (such as Windows Server and Linux). This candidate is expected to work collaboratively with the customer as well as groups of endpoint engineers and CI/CD engineers. Those engineers will look for expert advice during workload/software deployment / troubleshooting from this candidate.  This candidate will be responsible for the overall operations, configuration, fault resolution and upgrade of components inside the AWS cloud. Resourcefulness is a necessary skill in this role. You should be able to diagnose and resolve problems quickly. You should also have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary teams, peers, users and customers. Your goal will be to ensure that the technology infrastructure runs smoothly and efficiently.
Responsibilities:
  • Lead, plan, implement, track and report the routine patch management of workloads for Linux & Windows OSes. For workloads that fail the patching, troubleshoot, test and escalate to principal vendors.
  • Lead, plan, implement, remediate, track and report the routine vulnerability scan of workloads and applications. For workloads that fail the remediation, troubleshoot, test and escalate to principal vendors.
  • Manage the access control and privilege access to applications, workloads, OSes, features and functionalities inside the AWS subscription.
  • Manage the assets, licenses, inventory and other soft assets in the AWS subscription, giving the customer full visibility on assets, features and functionalities in use; thereby preventing unexpected charges and/or security issues dues to usage of specific functionalities.
  • Monitor and maintain the availability of the AWS subscription. Report scheduled or unscheduled downtimes to customer immediately. Troubleshoot and root cause any downtime and promptly provide incident reports clearly articulating the reasons for downtime. Recommend and enable best practices for higher uptime of workloads.
  • Report the status to customer during routine and ad-hoc meetings.
  • Attend to incidents and trouble-tickets and resolve it within the pre-defined Service Level Agreements.
  • Lead in the capacity planning and performance management of the AWS infrastructure
  • Lead in the analysis, diagnosis and resolution of faults for AWS operations.
  • Fullfill service and change requests relating to system provisioning, backup, log management, two-factor-authentication, security management, monitoring, etc
  • Adhere and participate in change management, problem management, release management, configuration management, disaster recovery and other ITIL processes.
  • Test and report on technology explorations and validation of systems components through proof-of-concepts.
  • Escalate and work to resolve issues with principal vendors during troubleshooting and support incidents.
Requirements:
  • Degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering or Information Technology or related disciplines.
  • Relevant cloud certifications such as AWS Certified SyOps Administrator
  • In-depth understanding of AWS Cloud.
  • Minimum 5 years of relevant IT infrastructure experience in the implementation, operations and maintenance of the following:
  • At least 3 year experience with common operating systems, including common flavours of Windows and Linux.
  • Good understanding of security operations, system security (e.g. intrusion detection systems, 2FA, etc)  and role based administration
  • Good understanding of networking, including network routing, IP addressing,
  • Experience administering sizeable AWS environments
  • Task automation via scripting such as Terraform, Cloud Formation, and ability to create scripts in Python, Perl or other language
  • Experience in DevOps deploying IT infrastructure using templates and scripts
  • Proven experience as a System Administrator, Network Administrator or similar role
  • Experience with databases, networks (LAN, WAN) and patch management
  • Resourcefulness and problem-solving aptitude
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Pro-active, dynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinking.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, customer orientation, team interaction/effectiveness, proactive, analytical and decision making skills.
",[],Senior Executive,,5 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)']",https://careers.stengg.com/job/Singapore-Cloud-Systems-Engineer/585053610/,70000,Singapore,sg

column2: Our company is known as Merck in the United States and Canada. Everywhere else, we are known as MSD. Merck & Co., Inc. is the legal name and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol ""MRK.""

MSD is an innovative, global healthcare leader that is committed to improving health and well-being around the world. Our core product categories include diabetes, cancer, vaccines and hospital acute care. We continue to focus our research on conditions that represent some of today’s most significant health challenges – like cancer, hepatitis C, cardio-metabolic disease, antibiotic-resistant infection and Alzheimer's disease, and we are on the front lines in the fight against emerging global pandemics, such as ebola. We also devote extensive time and energy to increasing access to medicines and vaccines through far-reaching programs that donate and deliver our products to the people who need them.
At MSD, we're applying our global reach, financial strength and scientific excellence to do more of what we're passionate about: improving health and improving lives.

Job description:

THE OPPORTUNITY
-    Join the premier biopharmaceutical company that has been in Singapore for more than 25 years and in AP for over 60 years.

Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
Increase adoption of DevSecOps tools and services designed to accelerate agile development projects via outreach.

  • Conduct training on using the DevSecOps tools and services to build awareness.
  • Understand user requirements and onboard their projects onto the DevSecOps platform leveraging best practices.
  • Practice Agile Way of Working.
  • Working in cloud-centric environments.
  • Write scripts and automation using Python/Groovy/Robot Framework
WHAT YOU MUST HAVE

  • Bachelor's Degree or MS in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
  • 2 to 3 years of hands-on experience at least in one scripting language
  • Proficiency in the following tools is a plus, Confluence, Jira, Bitbucket, Jenkins, SonarQube, JFrog Artifactory
  • Experience in practicing Agile Way of Working
  • Proficiency in container technology, e.g. Docker
  • Proficiency in cloud technology, e.g. AWS, Azure
  • Experience with enterprise scale applications supporting thousands of users
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT
  • Limitless opportunities across various areas in IT; well-structured career path
  • You will tackle the biggest challenges in the healthcare industry and information technology
  • Opportunity to learn and enjoy rewarding career that technology companies don't bring; the satisfaction of saving lives and making an impact!
Our Support Functions deliver services and makes recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the experience of working at our organization. Our Support Functions include HR, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security.

What we offer:

Who we are...

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for...
Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another's thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company.  No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Required profile:

.
