Zionext is a leading digital learning solutions company offering learning consultancy & design, learning platforms, learning media development, learning systems integration, custom application development and managed services. We provide one-stop end to end solutions for organization learning transformation.

We help corporations and educational institutions achieve their business goals by infusing innovative technologies and digital content to create impactful personal and team learning opportunities with positive business outcomes.

Our expertise and thought leadership in the full spectrum of digital learning solutions provide our clients a seamless experience in having all their organizational learning needs met.

We are wholly owned by SGX Catalist-listed Alpha DX Group Limited.

","

We are looking for a System/DevOps Lead Engineer to be part of our team. The incumbent will be leading the DevOps Team to build the infrastructure based on the project requirements. You will be required to maintain, automate, and improve on current build process workflows. You will also be expected to ensure efficient and reliable operations of the systems, and to participate in activities such as system upgrades planning, systems and application troubleshooting, and system performance monitoring.

Job Responsibilities:

• To lead the DevOps team to work alongside projects to build the infrastructure based on the project requirements and as a subject matter expert for any Sys/DevOps related issues

• To oversee that Infrastructure implementations are completed within the agreed timeframe, scope, cost optimization, without compromising quality.

• Assist in team development while holding team accountable for their commitments, resolving any outstanding technical issues faced in the course of projects, and mentoring and developing team members

• Operations and Maintenance of multitude of services hosted on AWS Cloud including RDS, Route 53, Elasticsearch, etc

• Monitoring server health and alert

• To maintain, automate and improve on current build process workflows.

• Write automation script using Shell script and PowerShell

• To work with the project and operational teams and ensure that the systems are delivered and accepted by client as per the project schedule.

• To ensure efficient and reliable operations of the systems, and to participate in activities such as system upgrades planning, systems and application troubleshooting, and system performance monitoring.

• To be technical lead and subject matter expert to provide architectural, technical and operation know-how to clients.

Job Requirements:

Knowledge and skills

• Knowledge of core Infrastructure services and functions (DNS, DHCP, LDAP, etc.)

• Thorough understanding of Active Directory design and Group Policy Administration

• Understanding of core messaging technologies (SMTP, Exchange, etc.)

• Create documentation on installation and configuration procedures

• Ability to participate in multiple projects in a fast-paced environment

• Ability to design, configure and monitor highly available solutions

• Strong networking knowledge

• Excellent Customer-oriented skills

• Excellent Database skills MS SQL

• Excellent in IIS management

Education, qualifications, and special training

• Degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent

Experience

• 5 years of experience in infrastructure

• Experience working with VMware ESXi

• Experience in Windows Server environment

• Experience in SAN setup & administration

• Experience in web technology

• Experience in Cloud Infrastructure

Personality requirements

• Responsible, self-motivated

• Able to multi-task and work under tight timeline

• Able to work independently and loves working in a team

What's In For You?

  • A fun, communicative and dynamic working environment!
  • Casual wear in office.
  • Medical coverage.
  • Flexible working hours.
  • Parental/childcare leave.
  • Birthday leave.
  • Free food and beverages.
  • Personal development benefits.

Zionext is also recently certified a Great Place To Work at, with 92% of people feel welcomed and cared for.

If you believe that any of the qualities fit you and you're up for a challenge worthwhile, we look forward to meeting you! :)

We regret only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Thank you!

Based in Singapore, with operations in China (including Hong Kong), Botswana and United Arab Emirates, ST Electronics (Info-Software Systems) has an excellent track record of solutions for defence and commercial sectors, and successful partnerships with our customers globally.","
As a Cloud DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible to deploy and configure solutions in the cloud (Public, Hybrid, Private).  You automate cloud operations, develop infrastructure automation scripts and participate in the continuous improvement of cloud solutions. You participate in the specification, setup and runs Proof of Concepts (PoC) and demonstrations. You define and deploy monitoring, metrics, and logging systems. You administer and maintain servers across virtual platforms and leverages COTS and/ or open source solutions to automate tasks. You create and improve procedures and author technical documentation to enable self-service for most operational tasks.
You are meticulous in your approach, possess inventiveness and attention to detail that aids in the development of solutions. You have the ability to understand the business requirements and propose affordable and feasible solutions.
Responsibilities:
  • Define requirements
    • Liaise with stakeholders to understand business needs and technical requirements
    • Analyze existing infrastructure components for potential migration to the cloud
    • Research emerging cloud and infrastructure technologies and IAC (Infra-as-a-Code)
    • Participate in technology assessments
  • Develop cloud solutions
    • Support the development and gap analysis of cloud-based DevOps solutions
    • Develop system and service deployment scripts
    • Test cloud-based solutions using specialized infrastructure tools, techniques and virtualization technologies
    • Develop automated processes to prevent, identify and fix problems and IAC (Infra-as-a-Code)
  • Implement cloud solutions
    • Implementation of Cloud Native DevOps OR Cloud DevOps solutions and IAC (Infra-as-a-Code)
    • Tune systems to ensure optimal performance
    • Monitor metrics around reliability, stability and performance of cloud infrastructure after implementation
    • Assist with the integration of third party technologies into cloud infrastructure
  • Maintain cloud solutions
    • Assist with preparation and maintenance of operational and technical documentation
    • Perform cloud infrastructure monitoring
    • Identify areas of improvement to help streamline operations
    • Provide cloud infrastructure support to users
    • Troubleshoot system issues and failures
Requirements:
  • Minimum of 2-5 years of experience. You have Cloud DevOps experience on Amazon AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
  • Cloud: Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, PaaS, IaaS, SaaS products and solutions
  • Platforms and tools: Jenkins, Artifactory, Python, other scripting languages and etc.
  • DevOps/Automation: Terraform IAC, OpsWorks, CloudFormation, Ansible, Chef, Puppet, and etc.
  • Security: Identity management, security monitoring, various compliance frameworks, and a deep understanding of core security concepts and processes as it relates to securing Cloud technologies
  • Consulting and Soft Skills: Business Needs Analysis, Emerging Technology Synthesis, Stakeholder Management
Cloud DevOps Proficiency in one of the clouds AWS, Azure and Google Cloud Platform and Tech stack proficiency (CI/CD) in Infrastructure Deployment, Infrastructure Design, Infrastructure Support, Network Administration and Maintenance, Network Configuration, Problem Management, Solution Architecture and System Integration, IAC (Infrastructure as a Code)

82,cloud engineer,/en/job/regional-cloud-steward-9413980,9413980,Regional Cloud Steward,False,False,,,SGD,Fugro Properties Pte Ltd,25-Mar-22,False,,23 days,197400964W,,,201 - 500 Employees,,Loyang Crescent,"<div>
About Fugro

Fugro is the world’s leading Geo-data specialist, collecting and analysing comprehensive information about the Earth and the structures built upon it. Adopting an integrated approach that incorporates acquisition and analysis of Geo-data and related advice, Fugro provides solutions. With expertise in site characterisation and asset integrity, clients are supported in the safe, sustainable and efficient design, construction and operation of their assets throughout the full lifecycle. Employing approximately 9,500 talented people in 61 countries, Fugro serves clients around the globe, predominantly in the energy and infrastructure industries, both offshore and onshore. In 2019, revenue amounted to EUR 1.6 billion. The company is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.

","

In support of Fugro's digitalization journey, there is a need for IT to have strong focus in improving upon the IT landscape to support the changing business requirements. Cloud adoption and its effective use play a key role in achieving this journey within Fugro.

The Regional Cloud Steward is a change role with a specific business focus. This role is key in supporting the business in successful cloud adoption and cost-effective use. This will be achieved by pro-active engagement with Cloud users to support cloud adoption or usage. The individual is a trusted advisor to regional management.

  • Work with business users of Cloud applications to understand and advise on cost optimisations and Life Cycle Management in cloud processes
  • Facilitate cloud communication in both the region and globally to support information sharing
  • Understand and define cloud governance practices and policies with Technology Architect to be implemented in the regions
  • Work with Fugro Academy to transform business needs into a Cloud Training Program
  • Support the Cloud Services Lead in translating business requirements to cloud roadmap
  • Collaborate closely with IT Services Domains to include governance and best practises in cloud usage

Analyse & Understand           

  • Translate business, innovation and IT needs into cloud training program in cooperation with Fugro Academy
  • Translate business, innovation and IT needs into cloud strategy and roadmap in collaboration with Cloud Services

Monitor & Advice      

  • Facilitate periodic meeting with cloud account owners to review cloud costs and advise on cost optimizations
  • Monitor, support and enforce use of tagging of cloud resources
  • Monitor regional cloud costs, intervene and pro-actively reach out to account owners when anomalies occur
  • Support business in cloud cost estimation and forecasting for client projects and setting proper budgets
  • Report on Cloud Costs to executive management

Implement policies and best practices          

  • Assist the cloud users to adopt cloud policies, standards and tooling
  • Support Regional Cost Controllers in invoicing process
  • Support in implementation of cost optimisations initiatives

Facilitate         

  • Organise and facilitate regional training programs
  • Act as facilitator for communication in cloud community

Education:       Bachelor / Master. Computer sciences, engineering, business, or relevant professional experience.

Working experience:  3-8 years.  Ideal candidates would have work experience in both business analysis and IT technology roles. Experience in cloud operations is preferred.

Management experience:      0-3 years. Ideal candidate has experience in managing people both from management and influence stand point 

License/ certification/ qualification: AWS Cloud Practitioner and/or Azure Fundamentals as a minimum.

Additional certifications in domain are beneficial.

Other experience      

  • Proven ability to take business strategy or vision and translate it into realistic, timely and cost-effective action plan;
  • Proven experience in influencing and inspiring diverse groups of people sitting across various geographic locations to work as team.

Professional Courage and Influence

  • Ability to work well alongside peers, colleagues and partners to positively impact the organization.
  • Ability to persuade and negotiate.
  • Facilitates commitment to finding the solution, whilst protecting all interests. 
  • Presents credible recommendations/rationale, links to business, customer, partner needs.

Passion for Learning 

  • Takes risks in learning by putting self in unfamiliar or uncomfortable situations in order to keep learning.
  • Actively seeks learning needs and proactively identifies and participates in all learning needs (e.g. courses, reading, coaching).

Business Acumen      

  • Supporting business needs. Attune and confidently acts to their needs, adding value and builds strong relationships.

column1: 88,cloud engineer,/en/job/lead-senior-cloud-devsecops-engineer-9286533,9286533,Lead / Senior Cloud DevSecOps Engineer,False,False,,,SGD,Central Provident Fund Board,15-Mar-22,False,,30 days,T08GB0007E,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: In CPF Board, we believe in achieving our mission and vision through motivated people who are committed to learn, upgrade and innovate.

People are important. Therefore, we create opportunities for our staff to develop their potential through our well-structured training & career development programme. We have also in place an attractive remuneration and benefits package.

We are looking for highly motivated, talented and committed professionals to join us in our mission to enable Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. If you have the relevant working experience, take up the challenge and apply today.","
As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family.
Information Technology

IT systems form the backbone of our operations. We are looking for individuals with passion and IT expertise, to help us improve the delivery of our systems and services.  The Board’s IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems.

Responsibilities:
The job holder will be responsible for designing, setting up, and maintaining platform solutions and a modern DevSecOps pipeline on the Government Commercial Cloud (GCC). While doing so, the job holder must ensure that the security and compliance requirements of the public service operating context are met. The goal is to enable developers to focus on building applications without paying heed to infrastructure, security and compliance.
The Product Development Lab is a new team, set up with the remit to develop software products on the cloud, inhouse and using cloud-native technologies where feasible. The role provides a rare opportunity in public service – one where the candidate can take decision and provide inputs that shape the whole software development process from end-to-end. In a nutshell, autonomy and flexibility is what’s on offer.
  • Collaborate with the other members of the Product Development Lab to map out the tech stack, development tools, infrastructure, and processes that will enable us to quickly deliver software in the CPF Board context
  • Set up a DevSecOps pipeline that is highly automated, easy to use, and meets the necessary compliance requirements
  • Provide prompt DevOps operational support when required
  • Planning for enhancements to keep the DevSecOps solution relevant and accommodate the changing needs of developers
  • Building and setting up new development tools and infrastructure
  • Continually research and find ways to automate and improve development and release processes
  • Ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats
  • Performing root cause analysis to identify technical problems, then investigating and resolving them.
  • Actively engaging the software engineers and developers on the team to suss out issues and areas for improvement
  • Stay abreast of trends and continually learn about new frameworks, technologies and programming languages.
Requirements
  • Experience in deploying and managing cloud resources on either AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience specific to Government Commercial Cloud is highly advantageous
  • Experience in building DevOps pipelines with a strong vision on what an ideal DevOps pipeline should look like
  • Experience in Cloud Native Technologies (e.g. Serverless / Docker / Kubernetes)
  • Knowledge of infrastructure security / security testing, identity and access management will be advantageous
  • While the experience and knowledge detailed above is desirable, what’s more important is a proven ability to learn and pick up new skills, especially in cloud technologies and programming languages
  • Intellectually curious and interested in technology
  • Enjoys analytical problem-solving effectively evaluate complex information and make appropriate decisions
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage, influence and win buy-in and commitment from key stakeholders and explain technical concepts in an easy-to-digest fashion
  • Good time management skills with ability to work independently and as a team-player
  • The seniority of appointment will be commensurate with relevant work experience
What you can expect
  • A challenging and rewarding career where you can contribute to national objectives
  • A friendly work environment with like-minded colleagues to co-create and collaborate together
  • A flexible schedule where work is not constrained to the office and 9-to-6 workdays
  • A productive yet growth-oriented workplace with flexible dress code where you are empowered to decide your appropriate outfit for the day
  • Position is on 2-year contract on commencement with possibility of renewal and conversion to permanent
  • Grow and gain valuable work experience where you can accelerate your career through promotion opportunities subject to individual performance
  • Comprehensive rewards package
  • Annual leave and pro-family leave
  • Medical and dental benefits
  • Access to recreational activities
",[],Senior Executive,,4 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,"Full-Time, Contract",,"['Dental', 'Medical', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Flexible Dress Code']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9286533&advertisement_id=9284904&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70120,North-East,sg

89,cloud engineer,/en/job/kyndryl-apprenticeship-trainee-graduate-program-4865700/origin/my,4865700,Kyndryl Apprenticeship (Trainee/Graduate Program),False,False,,,SGD,Kyndryl,16 hours ago,False,,,500613-M,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"

We have the world’s best talent that design, run, and manage the most advanced and reliable technology infrastructure each day. Together, we think holistically about the health of these vital technology ecosystems.

We will be a focused, independent company that builds on our foundation of excellence by creating systems in new ways. Bringing in the right partners, investing in our business, and working side-by-side with our customers to unlock potential. We're raising the bar.

Our experience speaks for itself: We have 90,000 highly skilled employees around the world serving 75 of the Fortune 100. But our purpose is what drives us: Advancing the vital systems that power human progress. Because when a digital ecosystem is healthy, it can more readily adapt and support continuous growth and that opens up a world of possibility for everyone.

Together, we are the heart of progress.

","

Why Kyndryl

Our world has never been more alive with opportunities and, at Kyndryl, we’re ready to seize them. We design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. Kyndryl is at the heart of progress — dedicated to helping companies and people grow strong. Our people are actively discovering, co-creating, and strengthening. We push ourselves and each other to seek better, to go further, and we carry this energy to our customers. At Kyndryl, we want you to keep growing, and we’ll provide plenty of opportunities to make that happen.

Kyndryl’s Apprenticeship Program (Trainee/Graduate program) - What we offer:

The Apprenticeship program will commence in 2022 and will be a 12-month structured development and on-the-job training program to enable fresh graduates and junior professionals to acquire tech skills and competencies for jobs in demand by the industry. This will offer you a fantastic chance to quickly integrate and embed in Kyndryl Singapore.

Your journey will begin with a 6 months fundamental training followed by a 6 months advanced training program that will equip you with on-demand technical skills and opportunities to gain the professional certificates.

You can look forward to a structured 12-month journey consisting of progressive skills training, coaching from managers, networking with senior leaders, and managing high-impact projects.

Roles are open:

Cloud Engineer: Hybrid Cloud DevSecOps Deployment 

This speciality implements a DevSecOps deployment within a client environment. Creates Container Platform Cluster, DevOps Toolchain. Provisions infrastructure considering cloud native architecture and deployment models. Performs Infrastructure as code provisioning and creation of sandbox environment. Possesses skills in popular DevOps automation tools, can perform installation and configuration of these tools on cloud or non-cloud infrastructure. Understands the project and application context and accordingly configure the DevOps tools, setup continuous integration for automated and continuous builds, develop build script & versioning, build packaging and deployment on the server, and setup continuous testing. Has knowledge of software engineering processes, coding (Java, Shell, Python), DevOps best practices, SDLC processes. Identifies the tools best suitable for integrating to CI/CD pipeline for Performance, Code Quality, Code Coverage measurement and defines the quality gates in CI/CD pipeline.

Cloud Engineer: Hybrid Cloud Projects (Cloud Platforms)

Infrastructure Specialists for Hybrid Cloud Projects (Cloud Platforms) deliver multi-cloud project services leveraging their cloud platform subject matter expertise in one or more public cloud environments. Services include design, implementation and customization of products and technology delivered in a time-bound, milestone based project schedule driven by client requirements and delivered using IBM service methodology. Project services typically involve heavy interaction with the client in support of concluding the project to meet the client's requirements.

Cloud Engineer: Hybrid Cloud Projects (Virtualization)

Infrastructure Specialists for Hybrid Cloud Projects (Virtualization) deliver multi-cloud & infrastructure project services leveraging their Windows and virtualization subject matter expertise in both traditional and cloud environments. Services include design, implementation and customization of products and technology delivered in a time-bound, milestone based project schedule driven by client requirements and delivered using IBM service methodology. Project services typically involve heavy interaction with the client in support of concluding the project to meet the client's requirements.

Network Engineer: SDN Design & Implementation Projects

Network Services Specialists for SDN Design & Implementation Projects apply their technical skills in client billable project services to support the design and implementation of a software defined network. They will use assets and reference architectures, build proof-of concepts, build and execute implementation plans, testing plans and deployment plans with network technology and networking solutions to address client requirements and work with products or solutions based on partner hardware and/or partner software.

Security Engineer: System Security Checking

This specialty is a subject matter expert qualified to perform security health checks within a managed services environment. Must have in-depth knowledge of the Security Health Check global process and supporting procedures. Ability to use appropriate tooling and automation depending on the product or technology being health checked.

Other Attributes & Skills we are looking for:

  • Excellent learning skills
  • 2022 graduate from an undergraduate or postgraduate degree in either Computer Science, Information Technology, Research, Data Analysis or similar, or have less than 3 years of professional experience in the technology industry
  • A team player with excellent communications and interpersonal skills
  • Strong organisation skills, being resilient and able to react to changes quickly whilst working in a fast-paced environment
  • Self-driven and energetic
  • Passionate for innovation and problem solving and comfortable working in Cloud, Network, Security, etc.
  • For fresh graduates, previous internship experience in technology industry is desirable
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English are essential.
",[],Entry Level,,,Not Specified,,Internship,,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=4865700&advertisement_id=4863388&s=10&AdvertisementSource=1,70000,Singapore,my

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
  • Participate in efforts that tailor the company’s security policies and standards for use in cloud environments
  • Propose and/or design technical solutions, which include creating prototypes and proofs of concept while maintaining a security mindset
  • Work closely with cloud platform architects to deliver creative solutions to complex technology challenges and business requirements.
  • Automate security controls, data and processes to provide better metrics and operational support
  • Utilize Public cloud-based APIs when appropriate to write network/system level tools for securing cloud environments
  • Stay current on emerging security threats, vulnerabilities and controls.
  • Identify detect and remediate failures in security controls by executing continuous instrumentation and validation of security capabilities
Requirements
  • Has a demonstrable experience as a Public Cloud Engineer ( Experience in Openshift or any other containerization software would be nice but not evaluated as a primary skill)
  • Bachelor’s degree on any STEM academic discipline
  • Minimum of 5-7 years of IT Security and/or security engineering experience in Public Cloud (on premise administration or any network experience will not be evaluated)
  • 5-7 years related experience in Cloud Engineering. Clear passion for Cloud Security and Cloud technologies.
  • Must have experience with virtualization (cloud or non-cloud)
  • Expert knowledge of Cloud infrastructure, security architectures, and standards
  • Deep technical knowledge of Amazon Web Services (more than 5 years in demonstrable projects, we will request evidences to cover this point)
  • Able to demonstrate clear understanding of current threats to Public Cloud infrastructure
  • Able to automate/script daily tasks through Python and/or JavaScript (last 5 years of demonstrable hands-on experience)
  • Experience with web-based applications or web-services
  • Proficient in Linux system administration, automation and operations
  • Experience in designing and implementing standards, specifications and procedures.
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative and accountability for achieving results.
  • Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of network and web related protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, UDP, IPSEC, HTTP, HTTPS, routing protocols)(not only applied to onprem infrastructures)
Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column2: RecruitFirst is the fastest growing human resource consultancy in the Asia Pacific. Our mission is Helping People Find Better Jobs, and Organisations Find Better People. We live by this mission by ensuring that the best candidates and employers are connected via the rigorous recruitment processes and extensive database that we are continuously developing.

column1: <div>

column2: Be the first to recruit with us and start realising the value-add that we are able to provide to your organisation!
Enjoy the expansive array of human resource solutions and network which RecruitFirst has to offer.

Together with our affiliates, we have operations in 8 countries and 10 cities across Asia Pacific – Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Beijing, Guangzhou, Taipei, Tokyo and Seoul. This geographical network gives us the strategic advantage of acquiring the best candidates to satisfy the human resource strategies of multi-national companies. In addition, with this large network of consultants, we are also able to provide for all your human resource needs, including, temporary staffing, contract staffing, executive search, payroll services, global placement or management consultancy.

","
Hiring for one of the largest gaming MNC in the world 
Role:
  • Work with business users and data platform team for requirement gathering and process collaboration
  • Develop data processing pipelines for data modelling, analysis, and reporting from worldwide datasets
  • Usage of Data Warehouses and advanced SQL in data retrieving
  • Build BI dashboards with Tableau and internal BI tools for data insights and business support & analysis

Requirements & Skills:
  • Degree in Computer Science or related technical field with at least 6 months of internship experience in data works
  • Highly proficient in advanced SQL
  • Good understanding of Python
  • Working experience in building BI dashboards with Tableau and other BI tools
Other Information: 
  • Hybrid Work Model (WFH / Marina One Offices) 
  • Mon - Fri, 9am - 6pm 
  • Between $5,300 -  $5,800 per month 
Interested candidates, kindly send in your resume to joeylee@recruitfirst.com.sg

Senior Cloud Enablement, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (210000BC)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Job Purpose
DBS is a leading regional bank, embracing innovation and digital technologies with a vision of Making Banking Joyful for our employees and our customers. We are underway with a Technology Transformation strategy, known as 'Gandalf', with clear vision to 'Design for Modern Systems' and 'Automate Everything', including to fully embrace both private and public cloud.In 2018 we intend to accelerate our Public Cloud journey, already in place for a number of applications in production, to adopt AWS natively, with confidential data, and at scale.A team has been created and is striving to deploy applications with confidential data and native services, and our target is to progressively enable more workloads with a scalable, automated, self-service approach.
Key Accountabilities
Work in a small multi-functional team to facilitate Public Cloud adoption across the organization for all workloads. Partner with and assist all Technology teams.The Cloud Engineer is expected to;
Responsibilities
  • Implementation of the compliance engine in coordination with the Platform Architect and Engineers
  • Implementation of the directive and detective control surface as per the detailed designs provided by Platform Architect and Security Architect
  • Implementation of test cases for the Canary testing framework
  • Daily operational review of all open compliance alerts and action remediation
  • Produce reporting and insights into the compliance landscape on a repeating basis
  • Provides T2 escalation support for key platform services such as networking, core services, identity, compliance frameworks, and other core services
  • Diagnoses, reports, and produces root-cause reports for review and feature/bug tracking by the Platform Architect and Operations Architect
  • Monitors and maintains the overall compliance against the latest DBS SOE and assists with remediation activities
Requirements
  • 2+ years in enterprise operations and automation development environments 
  • 2+ years working in a production support environment implementing at-scale monitoring, failover, or recovery technologies 
  • Thorough understanding of cloud operational controls and practices 
  • 1+ years of experience with native cloud technologies such as Auto-Scaling, healing, CloudWatch, Lambda 
  • 1+ years in scripting skills - working with operational and services level controls such as system.d 
  • Strong experience with CI/CD methodologies, processes and tools, such as Atlassian Bamboo, Jenkins, CodePipelines, CloudFormation 
  • Strong experience with logging & event management tools such as Splunk etc 
  • Solid skills in technical writing and production of technical documentation 
  • Experience in working in and with Agile delivery teams / projects / programs 
  • Cloud certification preferred i.e. AWS/AZURE/G Cloud 
  • Programming language proficiencies include NodeJS, Python, Java and C# 
  • Experience with DevOps Tools such as Ansible, Chef, Jenkins, etc. 
  • Hands-on experience with writing code i.e. AWS Lambda, CloudFormation 
  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or commensurate experience
Critical Competencies
  • Strong grasp of operational processes for an enterprise-grade cloud platform; 
  • Experience developing new and enhancing existing ITSM processes; 
  • Core understanding of 'at scale' cloud engineering principles and architectures 
  • Lead software development and automation skills 
  • Expert knowledge of service offerings and operational behaviours 
  • Expert knowledge of Continuous delivery and change automation principles
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
Senior Cloud Enablement, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (210000BC)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Job Purpose
DBS is a leading regional bank, embracing innovation and digital technologies with a vision of Making Banking Joyful for our employees and our customers. We are underway with a Technology Transformation strategy, known as 'Gandalf', with clear vision to 'Design for Modern Systems' and 'Automate Everything', including to fully embrace both private and public cloud.In 2018 we intend to accelerate our Public Cloud journey, already in place for a number of applications in production, to adopt AWS natively, with confidential data, and at scale.A team has been created and is striving to deploy applications with confidential data and native services, and our target is to progressively enable more workloads with a scalable, automated, self-service approach.
Key Accountabilities
Work in a small multi-functional team to facilitate Public Cloud adoption across the organization for all workloads. Partner with and assist all Technology teams.The Cloud Engineer is expected to;
Responsibilities
  • Implementation of the compliance engine in coordination with the Platform Architect and Engineers
  • Implementation of the directive and detective control surface as per the detailed designs provided by Platform Architect and Security Architect
  • Implementation of test cases for the Canary testing framework
  • Daily operational review of all open compliance alerts and action remediation
  • Produce reporting and insights into the compliance landscape on a repeating basis
  • Provides T2 escalation support for key platform services such as networking, core services, identity, compliance frameworks, and other core services
  • Diagnoses, reports, and produces root-cause reports for review and feature/bug tracking by the Platform Architect and Operations Architect
  • Monitors and maintains the overall compliance against the latest DBS SOE and assists with remediation activities
Requirements
  • 2+ years in enterprise operations and automation development environments 
  • 2+ years working in a production support environment implementing at-scale monitoring, failover, or recovery technologies 
  • Thorough understanding of cloud operational controls and practices 
  • 1+ years of experience with native cloud technologies such as Auto-Scaling, healing, CloudWatch, Lambda 
  • 1+ years in scripting skills - working with operational and services level controls such as system.d 
  • Strong experience with CI/CD methodologies, processes and tools, such as Atlassian Bamboo, Jenkins, CodePipelines, CloudFormation 
  • Strong experience with logging & event management tools such as Splunk etc 
  • Solid skills in technical writing and production of technical documentation 
  • Experience in working in and with Agile delivery teams / projects / programs 
  • Cloud certification preferred i.e. AWS/AZURE/G Cloud 
  • Programming language proficiencies include NodeJS, Python, Java and C# 
  • Experience with DevOps Tools such as Ansible, Chef, Jenkins, etc. 
  • Hands-on experience with writing code i.e. AWS Lambda, CloudFormation 
  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or commensurate experience
Critical Competencies
  • Strong grasp of operational processes for an enterprise-grade cloud platform; 
  • Experience developing new and enhancing existing ITSM processes; 
  • Core understanding of 'at scale' cloud engineering principles and architectures 
  • Lead software development and automation skills 
  • Expert knowledge of service offerings and operational behaviours 
  • Expert knowledge of Continuous delivery and change automation principles
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Loftware is the global market leader in Enterprise Labeling and Artwork Management Solutions with more than 5,000 customers in over 100 countries. Offering the industry’s most comprehensive digital platform, with SaaS, cloud-based and on-premise solutions, Loftware redefines how enterprises create, manage and print complex labeling and packaging artwork and scale across their operations.

Loftware solutions integrate with SAP®, Oracle® and other enterprise applications to produce mission-critical barcode labels, documents, RFID smart tags and packaging artwork. Our combined platform–whether for labeling, artwork management or both–enables customers to uniquely meet regulatory mandates, mitigate risk, reduce complexity, ensure traceability, improve time to market and optimize costs as they meet customer-specific, brand, regional and regulatory requirements with unprecedented speed and agility.

","

Loftware is the global market leader in Enterprise Labeling and Artwork Management solutions with more than 5,000 customers in over 100 countries. Offering the industry’s most comprehensive digital platform, with SaaS, cloud-based and on-premise solutions, Loftware redefines how enterprises create, manage and print complex labeling and packaging artwork and scale across their operations. Loftware solutions integrate with SAP®, Oracle® and other enterprise applications to produce mission-critical barcode labels, documents, RFID smart tags and packaging artwork. Our combined platform – whether for labeling, artwork management or both – enables customers to uniquely meet regulatory mandates, mitigate risk, reduce complexity, ensure traceability, improve time to market and optimize costs as they meet customer-specific, brand, regional and regulatory requirements with unprecedented speed and agility.

Loftware is expanding its worldwide Cloud Operations Team and we are looking for a technically motivated System Engineer with a strong reliability-focused Linux and systems administration background to be based in our global offices or work remotely. This is an excellent opportunity to expand your skills in the cloud or to learn from us. The Systems Engineer will be hands-on and involved with building, maintaining and troubleshooting development, QA and production customer environments for worldwide SaaS customers mission-critical application use (in AWS and/or Azure). The Systems Engineer is someone that is a team player with the desire and passion for modern technology to take on large-scale responsibility and interested in the cloud.

The Systems Engineer will work with building and maintaining reliable cloud infrastructure and services based on the Red Hat/AWS Linux 2 OS within AWS EC2 to deliver automated, highly available and scalable solutions that Loftware customers rely on.

You will have experience with administrating the runtime of enterprise software on Linux OS distributions running in virtual environments. Specifically, demonstrable experience administrating and troubleshooting highly available environments, proactive monitoring, security/firewall administration, storage management, patch management, log file analysis and backups.

Job responsibilities

  • Perform installation, configuration, administration and maintenance of high availability enterprise solutions that implement industry standards using Linux systems deployed within AWS EC2.
  • Perform proactive hands-on system administration, reliability monitoring, technical efficiency tuning, up-time, alert notifications and automation tasks.
  • Design, create and update automation scripts using Ansible, Terraform, Cloudformation and Jenkins with a focus on AWS operations and software deployment/configuration.
  • Administration of Amazon RDS and standalone databases, using SQL language and DB skills
  • Ownership in the diagnosis and issue resolution process, including the determination and provision of workaround solutions or escalation where necessary.
  • Installation and troubleshooting infrastructure/software runtime solutions using both AWS/Red Hat Linux and Windows operating systems.
  • Perform operating system upgrades, apply patches and service packs as appropriate.
  • Identify and raise technical risks.
  • Produce/update documentation on system processes to meet compliancy/auditing regulations.
  • Effectively communicate at all levels of the organization.
  • Comply with all IT and Information Security policies and procedures; help respond to audit requests.
  • On call/Out of Hours emergency action in the event of environment failure.

Specific skills

  • 7+ years experience in hands-on enterprise technical systems administration and implementation with similar duties.
  • 3+ years experience in implementing enterprise deployments with similar duties.
  • Excellent communication skills - written and oral and detail oriented.
  • Demonstrable, Linux (Red Hat preferred) and Windows skills - operating system deployment/operational administration and security experience – Linux command line work is mandatory.
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills – particularly in an enterprise Java environment involving the deployment and runtime aspect of application servers (specifically Tomcat) and databases (Oracle, PostgreSQL, SQL Server)
  • Experience/awareness of automated DevOps activities, concepts and toolsets a plus
  • Good database skills including the use of SQL and associated database management tools.
  • Good technical networking skills including subnetting, addressing and Site-To-Site VPN.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, production environment, both in teams and in isolation with a minimum of supervision in 24x7x365 type team structures.

Experience

Preferred

  • 7 year(s): Hands-on enterprise technical systems administration and implementation with similar duties

96,cloud engineer,/en/job/devops-engineer-9357573,9357573,DevOps Engineer,False,False,4000,6000,SGD,Doxa Holdings International Pte. Ltd.,22-Mar-22,False,,,201903315R,,,,,,,"About Doxa

Doxa is an early-stage startup that is relentless in addressing industry pain points, improving workflow and communication, and creating tight connections within an ecosystem. Through our award-winning B2B SaaS collaborative trade platform, Doxa Connex, we are pioneering completely new features for our clients, beginning with the built environment sector. With our upcoming Series A round, we're looking to bring in a new group of talents to join us in taking our disruptive solution to market more aggressively.

DevOps Engineer

We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to produce and implement functional software solutions. In this role, you should be able to work independently with little supervision. You should have excellent organisation and problem-solving skills. If you also have hands-on experience in software development and agile methodologies, we’d like to meet you. Your goal will be to develop high-quality software that is aligned with user needs and business goals.

Responsibilities
  • Provide day-to-day support for all systems running on Linux and Windows platforms, primarily on AWS
  • Design, develop automation code for deployment and maintenance of infrastructure and applications through CI/CD pipeline
  • Automate tasks through appropriate tools and scripting
  • Work with development teams and product managers to ideate software solutions
  • Identify, prioritise and execute tasks in the software development life cycle
  • Develop tools and applications by producing clean, efficient code
  • Review and debug code
  • Perform validation and verification testing
  • Collaborate with internal teams and vendors to fix and improve products
  • Document development phases and monitor systems
  • Ensure software is up-to-date with latest technologies

Qualifications
  • BSc in Computer Science or a related degree
  • Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer
  • Experience with building, deploying and maintaining CI/CD pipelines.
  • Good understanding of DevOps principles
  • Experience with scripting language such as Python, Groovy, BashScript, Powershell or equivalent
  • Extensive experience in software development, scripting
  • Familiarity with various operating systems (Linux, Mac OS, Windows)
  • Analytical mind with problem-solving aptitude
  • Ability to work independently
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills
  • Great attention to detail
  • Hands on experience in AWS (Configuration Management), Docker, Kubernetes (Microservices), Terraform or CloudFormation (Infra-as-code), Jenkins (CI/CD)
  • Monitor, continuously improve performance, cost optimization, operation, administration, CI/CD processes in AWS and/or Azure
  • Certified AWS DevOps Admin or Cloud Solution Architect is preferred
  • Knowledge of web services, API, REST and RPC will be an advantage

column2: MoneyOwl is a financial adviser and fund management company licensed by the MAS. We aim to empower you to live life to the full by helping you make wise money decisions easily and confidently.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: We are Singapore’s 1st Bionic Financial Adviser! To be Bionic means to have the best of both worlds – humans and technology. Technology integrates complex financial models into your financial plan with ease and precision. But we understand that money is very personal and involves emotions, aspirations and life decisions. That’s why both our dedicated client advisers and our technology platforms come together to journey with you in every stage of your life.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: We provide a one-stop service platform that is everything you need to develop a fit-for-purpose financial plan. Incorporating national schemes such as CPF, we provide impartial, competent and comprehensive financial advice and fund management services in support of your plan.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
MoneyOwl is a social enterprise and a joint venture between NTUC Enterprise Co-operative Limited and Providend Holding Private Limited. We exist to serve you!","

We are looking for a dynamic, talented team player for the role of DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic MoneyOwl family.  

Candidate will support and administer the setup that we had deployed while ensuring high availability and performance are maintained in order to support the business operations. The role will also serve as one of the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for cloud, container and DevOps methodologies. 

The ideal candidate will need to architect, deploy, secure, manage and provide monthly report(s) on the cloud infrastructure to the Team Lead. The role is also the main point of contact for all issues pertaining to the AWS and DevOps environment, monitoring of systems and responding to incidents. 

Responsibilities 

  • Work closely together with a team of software developers to support the rapid testing and deployment cycle of the product.  
  • Perform hands-on work and automate tasks to manage and minimize issues that may delay the build or patches. 
  • Collaborate with different teams to deploy security solutions to enhance the security posture of the company in a feasible and cost-effective manner. 
  • Facilitation of security reviews activities such as penetration testing, secure code reviews, and design/architecture security reviews with various teams. 
  • Identify, troubleshoot, support and resolve any issues that occurs in the MoneyOwl environment to ensure that systems are at optimum performance. 
  • Plan and perform system maintenance, patching for operating systems, applications and security related items. 
  • Ensure that operational issues are appropriately identified, documented, tracked and resolved in the tracking system. 
  • Create, maintain and ensure detailed operational documentations and guides, such as IT policies, SOP, change management, are in place to ensure standardized system environments. 
  • Perform 24 by 7 system support, when required.  
  • Any other ad-hoc tasks as assigned 

Requirements

  • Diploma in a technical field such as Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related field
  • At least 4 years’ experience in a similar role
  • Strong analytical, project management, problem solving, troubleshooting and performance tuning skills
  • Strong understanding of security concepts including public/private keys, certificates, hashing, and encryption.
  • Knowledge of service delivery infrastructure, operational processes, ITIL concepts, orchestration, clustering, Business Capacity Process
  • Knowledge of information security concepts such as ISO 27001 concepts, MAS TRM and Outsourcing Guidelines, cloud reference architectures, public cloud security best practice, latest developments in software and systems security, security hardening, network protocols and application security.
  • Proven experience in establishing stable and maintainable IT systems through implementation of industry best practises and new technologies, to achieve efficient system management.
  • Experienced with Prometheus, Grafana & Alertmanager monitoring is required.
  • Experienced with Terraform, Kubernetes and Containerization.
  • Ability to build, explore, automate and optimize processes using tools like Ansible, Packer, Jenkins.
  • Have hands-on experience with Unix/Linux and comfortable with scripting in Bash for deployment and management.
  • Well versed with AWS public cloud
  • Good written, verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Self-motivated, positive-thinking, team player, takes ownership

column3: At ST Engineering, our purpose is to apply our technology and innovation to solve real-world problems and improve lives. Our dedication to excellence and our strong track record have earned us a distinctive reputation for quality and trust as a global technology, defence and engineering group. Our diverse portfolio of businesses spans the aerospace, smart city, defence and public security segments.

We succeed because of our ability to deliver what our partners and customers need. And our satellite communications equipment contribute to much of the world’s network connectivity.

Senior Cloud Enablement, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (210000BC)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Job Purpose
DBS is a leading regional bank, embracing innovation and digital technologies with a vision of Making Banking Joyful for our employees and our customers. We are underway with a Technology Transformation strategy, known as 'Gandalf', with clear vision to 'Design for Modern Systems' and 'Automate Everything', including to fully embrace both private and public cloud.In 2018 we intend to accelerate our Public Cloud journey, already in place for a number of applications in production, to adopt AWS natively, with confidential data, and at scale.A team has been created and is striving to deploy applications with confidential data and native services, and our target is to progressively enable more workloads with a scalable, automated, self-service approach.
Key Accountabilities
Work in a small multi-functional team to facilitate Public Cloud adoption across the organization for all workloads. Partner with and assist all Technology teams.The Cloud Engineer is expected to;
Responsibilities
  • Implementation of the compliance engine in coordination with the Platform Architect and Engineers
  • Implementation of the directive and detective control surface as per the detailed designs provided by Platform Architect and Security Architect
  • Implementation of test cases for the Canary testing framework
  • Daily operational review of all open compliance alerts and action remediation
  • Produce reporting and insights into the compliance landscape on a repeating basis
  • Provides T2 escalation support for key platform services such as networking, core services, identity, compliance frameworks, and other core services
  • Diagnoses, reports, and produces root-cause reports for review and feature/bug tracking by the Platform Architect and Operations Architect
  • Monitors and maintains the overall compliance against the latest DBS SOE and assists with remediation activities
Requirements
  • 2+ years in enterprise operations and automation development environments 
  • 2+ years working in a production support environment implementing at-scale monitoring, failover, or recovery technologies 
  • Thorough understanding of cloud operational controls and practices 
  • 1+ years of experience with native cloud technologies such as Auto-Scaling, healing, CloudWatch, Lambda 
  • 1+ years in scripting skills - working with operational and services level controls such as system.d 
  • Strong experience with CI/CD methodologies, processes and tools, such as Atlassian Bamboo, Jenkins, CodePipelines, CloudFormation 
  • Strong experience with logging & event management tools such as Splunk etc 
  • Solid skills in technical writing and production of technical documentation 
  • Experience in working in and with Agile delivery teams / projects / programs 
  • Cloud certification preferred i.e. AWS/AZURE/G Cloud 
  • Programming language proficiencies include NodeJS, Python, Java and C# 
  • Experience with DevOps Tools such as Ansible, Chef, Jenkins, etc. 
  • Hands-on experience with writing code i.e. AWS Lambda, CloudFormation 
  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or commensurate experience
Critical Competencies
  • Strong grasp of operational processes for an enterprise-grade cloud platform; 
  • Experience developing new and enhancing existing ITSM processes; 
  • Core understanding of 'at scale' cloud engineering principles and architectures 
  • Lead software development and automation skills 
  • Expert knowledge of service offerings and operational behaviours 
  • Expert knowledge of Continuous delivery and change automation principles
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column4: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

column3: <div>

column4: NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

column3: <div>

column4: Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

column3: <div>

column4: Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column3: For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

","
The School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering invites application for the position of Senior Research Engineer.The Senior Research Engineer will be responsible to translate high-level audio algorithms implemented in other audio prototyping software into a high-performance, architecture-specific code. He/She will work closely with other researchers to design and implement DSP algorithms that meet system-level constraints and will also be defining and implementing software architecture for real-time audio systems on prototype hardware containing a multitude of co-processors.
Job Responsibilities
  • Writing, debugging, optimizing and testing of source code with an emphasis on audio applications
  • Maintenance and improvement of existing audio algorithm code base including noise reduction, acoustic echo cancellation, automatic gain control, voice activity detection, packet loss compensation and other audio enhancements
  • Cloud and Edge programming
  • Supporting R&D and Feasibility Studies including defining the scope and goals of audio research tasks and completion of detailed reports on results and recommendations for development activities
  • Software development of new algorithmic audio processing solutions including the existing areas mentioned above and additionally including state of the art audio codecs, audibility and intelligibility enhancements, microphone array processing, 3D audio and other audio effects and enhancements
  • Project management tasks including creation and maintenance of requirements and schedule documentation for assigned projects, project budget etc.
  • Publish journal and conference papers as dictated by the assigned projects
Job Requirements
  • Master's degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering with emphasis in audio and acoustics signal processing
  • More than 5 years of technical and research experience
  • Strong audio signal processing fundamentals (for example, Fourier analysis, transfer functions, filtering, linear algebra, matrix algebra etc)
  • Perform independent research and development of emerging and future audio technologies
  • Experience conducting acoustic measurements using standard acoustic equipment (speakers, microphones, anechoic chambers, acoustic mannequins)
  • Ability to communicate findings and ideas to other teams and to management using both written documents and Keynote presentations
  • Ability to effectively contribute in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment
  • Preferred experience with spatial audio, acoustic room modeling, collecting, organizing and analyzing large data sets
  • Experience with speaker or microphone arrays, or machine learning is a huge plus
We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

As part of the Infra/DevOps team, the DevOps Engineer holds the responsibility and accountability for IT cloud-based applications’ infrastructure, network and security for Government agency and large MNC projects, as well as in-house projects. He/she should work closely with clients, product team (BA/Designers/PM), Quality Assurance (QA) team and operations to deliver projects in time with quality and reusable and scalable infrastructure and security framework and documentation. DevOps Engineer should be able to:

  • Administer, and maintain AWS Linux environments within hosted infrastructure and public clouds.
  • Architect the solution for the business needs and assist with its implementation.
  • Responsible for vulnerability assessment, penetration testing and recommend patches in our environment which is AWS and LEMP/LAMP.
  • Solid experience as a DevOps Engineer in a 24x7 uptime Amazon AWS environment, including automation experience with configuration management tools.
  • Experience with DevOps and Infrastructure as Code: AWS environment and application automation utilizing CloudFormation and third-party tools. CI/CD pipeline setup utilising either AWS services such as CodeBuild/Commit/Deploy or third-party tools such as codeship.
  • Engineer with experience in AWS, Docker/Kubernetes, CI/CD and capabilities in Linux operating systems.
  • Work closely with the development team and align security compliance around integration solutions.
  • Responsible and participates in release management, Infrastructure and system incident response.
  • Develop, manage and test disaster recovery plans annually. Ensure application storage, archive, backup and restore procedures are functioning correctly. Perform system preventive (such as security/OS patches) maintenance and execute annual audit and DR exercises.
  • Design, develop Unix scripts and execute established plans for disaster recovery based on industrial best practices.
  • Develops and updates system operation documentation/SOP related to new and existing systems.
  • Creates and builds physical and virtual OS and optimize AWS hosting cost through automated resource scaling.
  • Provides customer support by seeking to understand and address the customer's needs and expectations through effective communication, and collaboration.
  • Participates in on-call coverage (during business and after hours) to support all infrastructure and systems related incidents.
  • Performs miscellaneous job related duties as requested.
  • Handle multiple projects simultaneously.

Job Requirements:

  • Candidate should have at least 2 years AWS experience with using a broad range of AWS technologies (e.g. EC2, RDS, ELB, EBD, S3, VPC, Glacier, IAM, CloudWatch, KMS) to develop and maintain an Amazon AWS based cloud solution, with an emphasis on best practice cloud security.
  • Candidate with minimum 3 years of relevant working experience in DevOps for cloud-based solutions.
  • Candidate must possess AWS certification.
  • Candidates must possess at least a Diploma / Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent.
  • Require Experience and Proficiency with:
  • Linux System administration background
  • AWS foundational services, such as (EC2, SNS, S3, CloudWatch, ELB, Route 53)
  • CI/CD pipeline tools will be an added advantage
  • Scripting experience with Python, Go, Node.js
  • Experience with system monitoring tools (e.g. Nagios)
  • Experience with Docker & Kubernetes
  • Experience in Micro Service, Domain Driven Design development environment and AWS setup and provisioning
  • Experience with at least one RDBMS (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc) and NoSQL database (e.g. MongoDB, Amazon DocumentDB etc)
  • The following are added advantages:
  • Experience with Government agency projects
  • Experience with Government, internal and external audits
  • - Experience with MQTT, CoAP and other IoT standards and protocols
  • At least 1 year setup and management experience in Kubernetes
  • Team player with good communication and interpersonal skills. Added advantage for those who can speak both Chinese (in order to work with Chinese speaking product and design team to understand end user requirements, use cases and translate that into a programmatic and effective technical solutions.) and English languages.
  • Candidate has positive mindset, good time management, and is responsible, detailed and self-motivated.

108,cloud engineer,/en/job/lead-senior-cloud-software-engineer-9286520,9286520,Lead / Senior Cloud Software Engineer,False,False,,,SGD,Central Provident Fund Board,15-Mar-22,False,,30 days,T08GB0007E,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: In CPF Board, we believe in achieving our mission and vision through motivated people who are committed to learn, upgrade and innovate.

People are important. Therefore, we create opportunities for our staff to develop their potential through our well-structured training & career development programme. We have also in place an attractive remuneration and benefits package.

We are looking for highly motivated, talented and committed professionals to join us in our mission to enable Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. If you have the relevant working experience, take up the challenge and apply today.","
As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family.
Information Technology

IT systems form the backbone of our operations. We are looking for individuals with passion and IT expertise, to help us improve the delivery of our systems and services.  The Board’s IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems.

Responsibilities

This role sits within the Product Development Lab, a new team set up with the remit to develop software products on the cloud, inhouse and using cloud-native technologies where feasible. In this context, we are looking for someone who is driven and able to build delightful products that meet customer’s needs, while at the same time adhering to the stricter security and compliance context that the Board operates in. Beyond delivering the product, the job holder should also take ownership of it – not just the code base, but also the broader product/feature roadmap, in conjunction with the product owner.  
This role provides a rare opportunity in public service – one where the candidate can take decision and provide inputs that shape the whole software development process from end-to-end. In a nutshell, autonomy and flexibility is what’s on offer.
  • Write quality production code, design quality architectures, and ultimately build quality products on the cloud
  • Design prototypes, proof-of-concepts and systems that are of value to the business while adhering to the necessary security/compliance considerations of the operating context
  • Establish best practices for software development
  • Manage code deployments under the relevant DevOps pipelines
  • Provide feedback and inputs on the design of these DevOps pipelines
  • Work with business experts and product owners to figure out what to build/enhance, and how to go about it
  • Stay abreast of trends and continually learn about new frameworks, technologies, and programming languages to help in identifying potential new product opportunities
  • More senior candidates will be expected to conduct knowledge sharing and provide guidance to junior engineers
Requirements
  • Previous software development experience on the cloud
  • Experience in the following will be advantages:
    • Software development in the context of Government Commercial Cloud
    • Software development using cloud native technologies (e.g. serverless, Kubernetes).
  • While the experience detailed above is desirable, what’s more important is a proven ability to learn and pick up new skills, especially in cloud technologies and programming languages
  • Able to write code to solve abstract programming problems, and to debug code effectively
  • Intellectually curious and interested in technology
  • Enjoys analytical problem-solving effectively evaluate complex information and make appropriate decisions
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills to reason about code with other engineers and to explain solutions to others’, potentially including laymen
  • Strong time management skills with ability to work independently and as a team-player
  • Pro-active, self-driven and willing to take on challenges with a positive attitude even in situation of high pressure and ambiguity
  • The seniority of appointment will be commensurate with relevant work experience.
What you can expect
  • A challenging and rewarding career where you can contribute to national objectives
  • A friendly work environment with like-minded colleagues to co-create and collaborate together
  • A flexible schedule where work is not constrained to the office and 9-to-6 workdays
  • A productive yet growth-oriented workplace with flexible dress code where you are empowered to decide your appropriate outfit for the day
  • Position is on 2-year contract on commencement with possibility of renewal and conversion to permanent
  • Grow and gain valuable work experience where you can accelerate your career through promotion opportunities subject to individual performance
  • Comprehensive rewards package
  • Annual leave and pro-family leave
  • Medical and dental benefits
  • Access to recreational activities
