column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
SVP, Public Cloud Software Engineer Technical Lead, Technology & Operations - (WD26123)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. The role is for an experienced hands-on full stack developer that has either fundamental understanding or a deep interest in public cloud or experience with infrastructure automation and portal development. A deeply experienced software developer that has intimate knowledge of the nuances of multiple languages and frameworks with very good mentorship and team development abilities. The product portfolio includes portals and associated backends that deliver:
  • Multi cloud application onboarding 
  • Public cloud Deployment management and visibility
  • Compliance, operations, security, and cost governance visibility 
  • Automated infrastructure intervention workflows
  • Firewall and policy automation portals
  • Other public cloud management related functionality as required 
Responsibilities
  • Lead, mentor and contribute to direct execution of software development
  • This is a hands-on role where the developer lead by example earns the trust and respect of the team by delivering functionality and tending to operational exigencies that may arise
  • Code development, product strategy and integration with the DBS public cloud deployment pipeline and the public cloud services
  • Advocate for the customers via the implementation of easy to use features and healthy roadmap to solve real customer problems
  • Mentor on design process, instil SRE philosophy into development practices
  • Develop web application using technologies such as Angular, Java / Spring core and docker to be deployed on AWS & Google Cloud, using microservices as the software architecture pattern with freedom to choose the technology for each problem. e.g EKS, ECS, Lambda, API gateway or, load balanced EC2.
  • Ensure secure coding and existing software development lifecycle guidelines and standards are met
  • Participate in daily agile stand up scrum meeting and sprint planning and prioritization
Requirements
  • Proven recent experience in multi-tiered application development, and familiarity with design considerations such as Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), performance, scalability, re-usability and flexibility 
  • 8+ years experience in designing and developing web applications and solutions that are lightweight, responsive, and user-friendly
  • 5+ years of hands-on enterprise-level recent web development on any of the following: Angular, JavaScript, React, Vue or similar
  • 5+ years of professional enterprise software development experience of in any of the following: Java, Spring ,Python, Node, Go, C/C++
  • Command of web technology fundamentals HTTP, Websockets, Content Distribution, WAF, REST, JSON, YAML, CORS, Session/ cookies, SAML, OAuth
  • Production experience and general knowledge of common persistent stores such as SQL, DynamoDB, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Redis
  • General knowledge of infrastructure components, TCP/IP, DNS, ICMP, PKI, TLS
  • Good knowledge In Architectural Pattern such as MVC, DAO, and Design Patterns such as AOP, Facade, Factory, Singleton, etc.
  • Knowledge in Test Driven Development and Test Automation using GIT, Maven and best CI/CD practices Junit, Protractor, Selenium, etc.
  • Experience working under Agile methodology
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

At PointStar, we believe that cloud computing is the way forward for companies to transform their business and stay lean, efﬁcient and competitive in the marketplace. Our mission is simple – we are dedicated to empowering companies across Asia Paciﬁc with the best cloud solutions so that they can focus on the things that matters most – their business.

PointStar Pte Ltd was established in 2008 as a regional cloud services provider. As one of the pioneer in cloud solutions, we have transformed over 1,000 businesses, organisations and institutions across the globe with industry-leading cloud services from technology giants like Google, Cisco, HPE and NetSuite.
Since our inception, we have been guided by our core values that shaped our culture and the way we work:
<ul>

column2: • To place customer satisfaction as our number one priority.
• To practice continuous improvement in every area of our business.
• To maintain the highest standards of professionalism in everything we do.
• To equip our people with deep product knowledge.
• To create and add value to our customers’ business.

column1: What truly sets us apart is our vast experience in cloud technologies and a strong understanding of the way businesses operate. This enables us to offer a comprehensive, end-to-end cloud services to help our clients choose, adopt, implement, customise and manage their cloud solutions. Our team of qualified cloud architects and engineers ensure customers implement an elegant cloud strategy that are best ﬁt for their needs and goals.
Headquartered in Singapore, PointStar has since grown rapidly with clients that spans across the Asia Paciﬁc, including India, Sri Lanka, Hong Kong, Taiwan and China.
PointStar also has a regional presence in Jakarta, Indonesia and Johor, Malaysia. Take your business to the next level – embark on a successful cloud transformation with PointStar today!

column4: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

column3: <div>

column4: NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

column3: <div>

column4: Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

column3: <div>

The Strategic Centre for Research in Privacy-Preserving Technologies & Systems (SCRiPTS) invites applications for the position of Research Engineer I. 
 
Key Responsibilities: 

  • Design and development of privacy and security related system platforms, both from scratch and from open sources.
  • Design and develop software that meets specified standards of end-user requirements.
  • Design and develop system software that meets specified standards of end-user requirements.
  • Implement cloud systems, web services, API software and middleware for the Centre's privacy preserving technologies and machine learning platforms.
  • Build flexible and reliable applications on cloud computing platforms such as AWS or Microsoft Azure; as and when required by the team.
  • Learn to utilise advanced privacy preserving technologies.


Job Requirements: 

  • Minimum Bachelor's degree in computer science/ engineering or related fields.
  • Proficiency in programming languages Java, C/C++ is a must.  Experience in other programming languages and/or frameworks such as Python, Go, Spring will be an advantage.
  • Proficiency with using common Linux distributions such as Ubuntu, CentOS, RHEL etc. (including shell scripting) is a must.
  • Proficiency and experience with modifying open sources and/or developing system software platform for security/privacy such as clusion library or openSSE is a must.
  • Proficiency in installing, configuring and using SQL database is a must.  Experience in other data processing technologies such as NoSQL, Hadoop will be an advantage.
  • Experience on networking, communication protocols and socket programming is a must, as this is needed to develop backend messaging requirements for certain privacy libraries

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2: At Seagate, our mission is to give people peace of mind by protecting their digital lives.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: Since 1978, Seagate has been creating precision-engineered data storage technologies that deliver superior capacity, speed, safety, and performance. We help people harness and maximize the datasphere.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: Seagate couldn't do any of that without its employees—a diverse workforce of 40,000 creative, hard-working,  passionate people all over the world. From the Silicon Valley, the United Kingdom, Singapore, Malaysia, India,  Thailand, through China, our people are proud to embody the values of integrity, innovation, and inclusion. Consider joining them. Open up your world.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
WayUp - Top 100 Internship Program – 2020","
About our group:

This group will be a part of a large Cloud Engineering Operations team that is currently involved inbuilding, operating and managing cloud infrastructure for Seagate and potential external customers. The Cloud Operations will support 24 x 7 cloud operations involving multiple data centers across the world and support the storage needs of customers. The overall storage footprint to be supported in these data centers eventually will begin the magnitude of exabytes.

About the role - you will:
  • Work collaboratively with colleagues based in the US, Singapore and Malaysia to provide 24 x 7 cloud operations support
  • Work extensively with third-party contractors working in shifts to monitor and maintain service uptime
  • Get on troubleshooting incidents calls to restore service when needed
  • Track and maintain Service Level Objectives and Error Budget. Create operational dashboards, reports and other visual and quantitative management tools to track and report on network and system uptime, service interruptions, and other service level metrics
  • Shift: Morning Shift (7am to 7pm)
  • Maintain constant vigilance and situational awareness of all incidents, escalations and events related to maintaining service uptime
  • Work closely with the Cloud Development & Infrastructure Engineering team and Customer Support team.
  • Follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
About you:
  • Exposure to ITIL based service management, including implementing ITIL based control processes
  • Proven record of accomplishment managing IT service delivery in complex, mission-critical environment
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Good analytical skills
  • Well versed in the working with onsite/offshore and core team/flex team models
  • Familiar with DevOps, Continuous Integration & Delivery and Release on demand concepts
  • Used industry standards monitoring and logging tools like Zabbix, Prometheus and Fluentd
  • Familiarity with hardware load balancers, proxies, and firewalls
  • Familiarity with cluster management in Kubernetes or any other Cloud native environment
  • Knowledge of PowerShell, Bash, Perl or Python for scripting and automation
  • Linux scripting and Administration. Linux based deployment using Command Line Interface
  • Familiarity with Kubernetes and Kubernetes native applications
  • Familiarity with 100 Gbps network topology
Your experience includes:
  • Data Center Operations technical support
  • Production support of the main services offered to customers, troubleshooting outages and incidents, capacity planning, working closely with the customer support and development engineering team
  • Worked with cloud native apps and systems in an on-prem or private cloud environment
  • Kubernetes and Kubernetes native applications
  • Used NGINX and/or NGINX Plus
  • Complex network topologies and 100 Gbps networks
  • Used ITIL based ITSM tool, creation of SOPs, and problem triage
  • S3 or any other object storage highly desirable
  • Linux scripting and Administration. Linux based deployment using Command Line Interface
  • 100 Gbps network topology
  • Jira and GitLab
Location:

In response to COVID-19, this position may temporarily begin and be performed remotely. Seagate is actively evaluating the virus and our employees' health and safety are our top priority. In the future, this position will report to and be performed at our Shugart location. 

Location: Shugart, Singapore
Travel: None

column1: 353,cloud engineer,/en/job/infrastructure-engineer-nucleus-9231061,9231061,Infrastructure Engineer (Nucleus),False,False,,,SGD,NCS Pte Ltd,14-Mar-22,False,,20 days,199603123G,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">
<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
NCS is a leading technology services firm with presence in Asia Pacific and partners with governments and enterprises to advance communities through technology. Combining the experience and expertise of its 10,000-strong team across 49 specialisations, NCS provides differentiated and end-to-end technology services to clients with its NEXT capabilities in digital, cloud and platform as well as core offerings in application, infrastructure, engineering and cyber security. NCS also believes in building a strong partner eco-system with leading technology players, research institutions and start-ups to support open innovation and co-creation. For more information, visit ncs.co.","
Will you be part of the extraordinary?
We're guided by our vision of advancing communities, and bringing people and technology together to make the extraordinary happen.  NCS creates end-to-end technology solutions and services clients with its NEXT capabilities of digital, cloud, platforms as well as core offerings in Applications, Infrastructure, Engineering and Cyber Security, working on projects that impact millions every day. ​With our passion to innovate, you can tell that we're more than ready to meet the future. Join us and be part of this extraordinary journey too.
Your role is only the beginning​
At NCS, we pride ourselves on empowering our people and talent to their fullest potential. Learning together in our NCS DOJO , we have comprehensive, built-in, training and industry standard qualifications that will allow you to up-skill and re-skill as we grow together. Our 5-year Nucleus graduate programme brings together professional coaching and technical expertise to help you attain a Master of Technology with NUS-ISS or industry-recognised Professional certifications. To broaden your perspectives, we also have multiple ‘playgrounds’ that work as Project Teams, Client Tribes, Strategy Groups and Centres-of-Excellence based in Singapore, Shenzhen and Melbourne. And if there are any ideas or projects that interest you, we’re always listening and ready to play.What will you be expected to do?
Depending on the pathway that you are assigned to you will be exposed to different areas within Infrastructure. For example:
[Network]
  • Support network planning, design, implementation, and performance optimization
  • Support network daily operational tasks
  • Maintain network infrastructure and Resolve infrastructure incidents
[Systems]
  • Responsible for the system design, implementation, testing and maintenance of proposed system
  • Provide support to end users on a variety of system technologies including Microsoft Windows Server OS, Unix/Linux OS and Middleware.
[Cloud]
  • Assess and incorporate the ITIL standards into Private/Public Managed Cloud platforms to align with the industry best practices.
  • Operate and manage the cloud technologies that incorporates products, tools, self-service portals and automation.
  • Work with both the product managers and the engineering/development team to design/ develop, and deliver the Cloud product roadmap
What should you have?
  • Degree in Computer Science,Computer Engineering,Information Technology,Information Systems, Electrical and Electronic Engineering or equivalent practical experience
  • Fresh graduate or less than 2 years of relevant working experience
  • Keen interest in Networks, Systems, Automation, Cloud, ITIL and Digital Solutions
  • No experience is required. However, knowledge in the following areas may be advantageous:
  • IT Concepts (e.g. OSI/ITIL/ITSM)
  • Programming algorithm & coding (e.g. SQL/PHP/Python/Ruby)
  • Operating System (e.g. Linux/Microsoft/Cisco)​​
NCS​
Make extraordinary happen
  • Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be notified due to the high number of applicants for this role.

Responsibilities:
  • Automate cloud infrastructure and operations.
  • Write code for configuration management and to manage infrastructure as code.
  • Provide SME knowledge support to the wider Infrastructure Team on scripting.
  • Create and maintain SOPs and technical guides.
  • Ensure reliable operations of cloud workloads through monitoring and implementation of runbooks/playbooks.
  • Ensure cloud workloads are deployed in compliance to organization policies and guidelines.
  • Perform hardening of cloud platforms and ensure cloud workloads are configured securely.
  • Optimise cloud workloads according to 5 pillars of the well-architected framework.
  • Solicit requirements from system owners and cross functional teams to develop/evaluate solutions to meet requirements.
  • Work with Cloud Facilities Management (FM) in ensuring that cloud operations are performed according to agreed service levels.
  • Part of the team to troubleshoot issues and perform root cause analysis so as to resolve issues and prevent future occurrence.
  • Part of the team responsible for the overall system architecture, design, installation, configuration, technical support, and maintenance of system hosted in Major Cloud Providers.
  • Part of the team to establish and review IT policies and guidelines.
Requirements:
  • Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or related discipline
  • At least 2 years of experience in cloud administration and automation of one or more of the following cloud service providers:
    • Amazon AWS
    • Microsoft Azure
    • Google Cloud Platform
    • Huawei Cloud
  • Experience in hybrid cloud or cloud integration with on-premises infrastructure.
  • Experience in cloud migration from on-premises infrastructure to public cloud.
  • Experience with Infrastructure Automation Tools such as Terraform, ARM Templates, Cloud Formation, Kubernetes etc. is an added advantage.
  • Experience in system administration of Windows Servers (2016 and above), Red Hat and Ubuntu Linux will be an added advantage.

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. column1:
","

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

Job Description

The Smart Nation Sensor Platform (SNSP) is a Strategic National Project to provide situational awareness for Singapore. SNSP comprises a common infrastructure and services for IoT and related technologies. It will enable the use of sensor data and analytics to co-create Smart Nation applications to deliver better public services enhancing quality of life.

We are looking for a Cloud DevOps Engineer to deploy, test, automate and operate workloads in the cloud (primarily AWS services). The Engineer will work closely with product teams and capability centres to deploy and manage nation-wide services for SNSP. This role comprises aspect of technical and IT operations functions. It is expected that coding and scripting skills are required. The candidate should also has a balanced skillsets and aptitude to find solutions to problem identified.

What to Expect

  • Manage the operations of cloud infrastructure and application services
  • Develop and operate a variety of deployment scenarios including Cloud-based, on-premise infrastructure as well as IoT platforms
  • Design, build and integrate systems in an efficient and robust manner towards a high level of maintainability, reliability and availability
  • Perform agile development activities such that products or projects are delivered in accordance to the established SCRUM framework.
  • Manage in-house development team and outsourced contractors in delivering project and operational objectives
  • Support operationalization effort such as establish processes and best practices
  • Conduct design and review of application infrastructure hosted on premise and in the cloud
  • Ensure application infrastructure is compliant with established security standards
  • Create a high degree of systems usability that is balanced with stringent security requirements
  • Research and recommend innovative, and where possible, automate applications infrastructure and administration tasks
  • Periodic reporting to Management on operation benchmarks, performance metrics, capacity planning and system incidents

How to Succeed

  • Strong knowledge in managing a wide variety of enterprise applications systems in both Windows and Linux platforms (e.g. message broker, databases, web services, API gateway, PKI, load balancer, serverless workloads)
  • Hand-on experience in hybrid cloud infrastructure and AWS services.
  • Good appreciation of other cloud technologies such as Azure and GPC
  • Capable of managing an agile development team
  • Proficient in programming and scripting such as Golang, Angular, Python, .Net, Javascript, Java, PHP, etc
  • Good understanding and working knowledge of Agile projects such as SCRUM and KANBAN
  • Strong knowledge of Software Defined Network and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform and Ansible)
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced and complex work environment
  • Strong technical aptitude including excellent troubleshooting and communications skills

Preferred Skills

  • Qualification in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
  • At least 3 years of managing applications systems in production environment
  • At least 3 years of experience in Devops automation, containerisation and orchestration using tools such as Docker and Kubernetes
  • Relevant industry certification in application and operating systems would be an advantage

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours”

column1:
","

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) seeks to transform the delivery of Government Digital Services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with the public to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

As an Application Infrastructure Engineer, you will help to level up the team’s competency with your valuable skills. We value failure experiences as much as successful experiences. You will drive, implement, deploy, maintain and operate products or key components of the products. You will collaborate closely with different teams to deliver the best possible and impactful software solutions for whole-of-government.

Specifically, you will be working on central system development projects undertaken by the Clusters & Technology Management Office (CTMO) of GovTech Services. CTMO focuses on harnessing technologies to deliver common systems/platform that can scale and benefit many Government agencies to avoid duplication of effort and improve efficiency.

Passion, a proactive posture and dedication to your project and team will help you succeed in using groundbreaking technologies and innovative solutions to improve standardization.

What You Will Be Working On:

  • You will work on a Content Web Platform that seeks to provide common hosting services on Cloud for multiple systems/ websites across the Government.
  • Manage infrastructure services to support and standardize government-wide application systems environments by working closely with Applications Service Consultant at Public Service agencies
  • Support and maintain the development of application infrastructure reference architecture, resource planning, system integration and overall infrastructure operating environment performance in cloud computing platform.
  • Work closely with Product Managers to understand the challenges and come up with solutions, crafting proof of concepts (POCs) to affect understanding of underlying technology capability. Spin up own test environments to assess the validity of the technology, and iterate.
  • Support IT operations through harmonizing, fine-tuning of performance metrics, incident/problem management and process controls to make certain than the Information and Communications Technology (ICT) operations are effective, with alignment to ITIL principles.
  • Work with service providers to ensure their service deliveries, processes and documentations meet significant metrics and Service Level Agreements (SLA).

What We Are Looking For:

  • Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering, or related fields.
  • Good background of practising architecture design & solutioning for Cloud Infrastructure domains.
  • Certification(s) in Cloud Technology platform (either in Architecture, DevOps or System Administration/Sysops track), operating systems management, middleware or systems virtualization preferred.
  • Conversant with Application Infrastructure/Technical Architecture and Governance Processes.
  • Experience in .Net/ Web application development using Microsoft technologies (C#), Microsoft Azure Stack (SQL, WebApp, API App, Storage, CDN).
  • Good scripting skills in Power BI, Python, YAML, Javascript.
  • Knowledge in DevOps tools (Terraform, Ansible) or DevSecOps would be advantageous.
  • Hardworking, proactive and dedicated individual with strong leadership and multi-tasking capabilities.
  • Good interpersonal skills, both oral and written, with the ability to clearly articulate ideas and influence partners.

Preferred Skills:

  • ITIL v3 Foundation certification
  • Passion and belief in GovTech core values – Agile, Bold and Collaborative.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

column1:
","

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) seeks to transform the delivery of Government Digital Services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with the public to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

We are hiring Application Infrastructure Engineers with Full Stack Developer experience in a DevOps environment with broad and deep technical expertise across multiple verticals, methodologies and technologies to join us in codifying everything we do. Demonstrate your domain knowledge by being technically hands-on and participating in new innovative initiatives and improvements to meet the needs of forward-looking Public Service agencies.

What You Will Be Working On:

Develop and maintain web application that can supervise cloud infrastructure, configuration compliance and other requirements to improve DevSecOps automation capabilities.

  • Implement codification on new automation systems with integration to existing CI/CD environment to deliver business value in accordance to existing DevOps practices.
  • Participate in the development of application infrastructure reference architecture, system integration and acceptance and infrastructure performance testing, including new application system initiatives. The domain areas may include one or more of the following:
  • Familiarity with Infrastructure Automation methodologies and technology (e.g. HashiCorp’s Terraform).
  • Implementation, monitoring and maintenance of Infocomm Security Services across agencies, with a keen appreciation on application infrastructure security.
  • Management of IT infrastructure operations, monitoring of events, performance metrics, design & control production processes in ensuring ICT operations are efficient and effective, with alignment to ITIL principles.
  • Be responsible for one, or both, on-premise and cloud application infrastructure services to support application systems environments by collaborating with partners such as business analyst, solution architects and digital services managers.

What We Are Looking For:

  • Disciplines in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering, Information Technology, or related qualifications.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in developing frontend and backend of a web application.
  • Curious and enjoys turning everything into code!
  • Individual with strong automation experience with provisioning tools, continuous integration tools, and scripting languages to fulfil the Build, Test and Publish stages in the lifecycle.
  • Prior experience in writing high quality and maintainable code on open-source (Linux based) web platforms and frameworks for both frontend UX development and backend experience with RESTful APIs development.
  • Good understanding on the Cloud environment and prior experience with micro-service architecture and serverless framework would be advantageous.
  • Certification in at least one Cloud Technology platform (either in Architecture, DevOps or System Administration/Sysops track), operating systems management, middleware or systems virtualization, will be preferred.
  • Motivated, proactive and dedicated individual with good multi-tasking capabilities who thrive in a fast-paced working environment.
  • Passion and belief in GovTech core values – Agile, Bold and Collaborative.

Preferred Skills:

Experience with technologies in the following list will be advantageous such as:

  • Software development and scripting languages: JavaScript, TypeScript, YAML, Python, PowerShell and Shell
  • Web platforms and frameworks: NodeJS, ReactJS, Angular, Go, etc
  • SQL and NoSQL databases: MS SQL, MySQL, MongoDB
  • Continuous Integration/Delivery solutions: Gitlab CI, Travis, Jenkin, Bamboo, GoCD
  • Cloud hosting: Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform
  • Configuration languages: Terraform, Packer, Dockerfile

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

column2: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

column3: In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.

Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.

Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.

Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.

column1:
","
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 . Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.
Job Responsibilities
You will be responsible for leading the DevOps engineering excellence by rolling out DevOps capabilities, enhancing existing capabilities and optimizing the DevOps workflow for open systems, AS400, Mainframes, Containers and Cloud technology. The successful candidate will be a technically-savvy, dynamic leader, excellent communicator, have demonstrable technical hand-on supporting CI/CD toolset coupled with excellent infrastructure knowledge and automation expertise.  As part of a cross-functional product development group, you should be comfortable with working as part of highly-talented teams ensuring that modern technology and process are utilised as part of the role.
  • Lead DevOps capabilities roll out within the organization in terms of traditional, container and cloud pipeline adoption for entire SDLC automation.
  • Maintain the DevOps platform and toolset matching the enterprise FSI standard.
  • Shift left thinker with automation and workflow as the key driver to self-server the tasks for seamless automation.
  • Coordinate with the stakehers from requirements gathering until successful implementation DevOps Initiatives.
  • Work with the vendors to setup DevOps solutions considering market best practice, Industry standard and ease of support.
  • Work with the vendors to upgrade the DevOps tools farm and Integrating with tools.
  • Configure SSO, SSL, Load Balancer, Auto Scaling and DNS setup for the DevOps Toolset with naming convention.
  • Lead analysis and resolution of root cause for Test Orchestration / Environment related issues
  • Stay current with industry trends and leads development of key DevOps, Runtime, and Operational innovation platforms.
  • Build relationships, obtain buy-in for proposed initiatives at Steering Committee level.
  • Conduct design reviews and challenge existing thinking
Job Requirements
  • Deep technical background in the following, but not limited to:
    • installing, configuring, integrating, upgrading and patching CI/CD toolset (Bitbucket, Jenkins, Artifactory, Sonar, Veracode, JIRA and Confluence - ).
    • setting up CI/CD pipeline as a centralized solution as a framework.
    • DevOps governance, Security standards and audit requirements.
    • rolling out DevOps capabilities for Open Systems, IBM I (AS400) Mainframes platforms.
    • setting up Traditional, Container and Cloud DevOps pipeline for monolithic, container and cloud applications.
    • continuous testing, techniques and tools (Junit, Selenium, Tosca, Load runner, Performance Testing etc)
    • continuous security, techniques and tools (Software composition analysis (SCA), Static Application Security Testing (SAST), Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) and Interactive Application Security Testing (IAST))
    • automation accomplid with advanced Python, Chef, Ruby and Powerll
    • virtualization, cloud infrastructure and related technologies 
  • A strong passion for infrastructure as code and associated automation and provisioning tools 
  • Strong leadership, motivator and experience with high performing teams
  • Proven record of accomplishment of being result-orientated with demonstrated ability to achieve aggressive goals.
  • Excellent communication skills 
  • Evidenced delivery of complex projects
  • Security concepts and what makes for a secure solution
  • Analyzing, documenting and validating business requirements
  • Ability to advice on industry standard tools for monitoring, alerting, configuration manment and performance tuning
  • Able to design a strategy and then execute against it
  • Knowledge of AS400, mainframe beneficial
  • Comfortable working in a challenging environment
  • Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment 
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills; writing, publishing and conference-level presentation skills 
Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's , race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

column3: Karooooo Management Company Pte Ltd is a leading global provider of data analytic solutions for mobile asset management, asset recovery and workforce optimisation based on a proven Software-as-a-Service platform. Fleet management, Stolen Vehicle Recovery and insurance telematics services remain its core business, with a focus on technology development to enhance customer experience. The company is a service-centric organisation focusing on the in-house design, development and installation of telematics technology and data analytics.

Karooooo Management Company Pte Ltd technology is widely accepted by motor manufacturers and insurers. We’re a world-leading smart mobility SaaS tech company with over 1,500,000 subscribers across 23 countries. Our teams are collaborative, vibrant and fast-growing, and all team members are empowered with the freedom to influence our products and technology. 

Are you curious, innovative and passionate?

Do you take ownership, embrace challenges, and love problem-solving?  

We’re looking for a Lead Linux Systems Engineer who will enable us to build industry disruptive tech products and revolutionise the way our customers use technology. 

You want to

  • Install new systems (bare metal and virtual machines), rebuild existing systems and configure hardware with a focus on infrastructure as code and automation
  • Develop and maintain configuration management tools
  • Contribute to and maintain system standards
  • Work closely with Software Engineers to develop CI/CD pipelines
  • Research and recommend innovative and automated approaches for system administration tasks

  • Apply operating system patches and upgrades on a regular basis
  • Perform periodic performance reporting to support capacity planning

You have

  • Big data and supporting systems experience (Hadoop, S3, Cassandra, Kafka, RabbitMQ)
  • Container and Container Orchestration experience (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Experience running hybrid environment of on-premises and cloud services

About the Job

We need an internal Cloud Architect or full stack engineer member to define architect, and review vendor's code quality, and need to be hands-on on function implementation of our web portal and Mobile application. To prepare external ecosystem integration with our existing system and cloud infrastructure for migration, or if APIs is needed. Meanwhile to prepare for China market strategy on connectivity.

About the Team/Manager

You will be working in a team of 5 and report to the Technical Manager

Skills & Experiences Required

You will need to have min bachelor degree in computer engineering or related fields. Other requirements are as follow:

  • Experience working on any frontend javascript framework (React is what we are using).
  • Experience in using server-side language J2EE, springboot framework.
  • Expeirence in RDBMs (MySQL) & any NoSQL (MongoDB).
  • Understand Cloud architecture and capable pick up the architecture, adopt it for different requirement (AWS/Azure ).
  • Good to have Azure admin experience.
  • Android App Development is a PLUS.
This is a permanent role and pay up to 9k per month commensurate with you experiences and competency level.

Interested candidates please send your updated CV to steve.ling(@)randstad.com.sg
EA(94C3609/R1332781)

363,cloud engineer,/en/job/t24-support-engineer-sre-182245-worknow-9400695,9400695,T24 Support Engineer/SRE - #182245 #worknow,False,False,,,SGD,Credit Suisse (Singapore) Limited,21-Mar-22,False,,30 days,197702363D,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column2: The Credit Suisse Group purpose is at the core of everything we do. It underpins the value we create and has powered our progress for more than 160 years. It captures the essence of 'why' we exist as an organization. It motivates us when we come to work every day and serves as our North Star when we make decisions. Ultimately, it serves to define who we are and what we should be doing for our employees, clients and stakeholders.

Our strategy builds on Credit Suisse's core strengths: our position as a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities and our strong presence in our home market of Switzerland. We seek to follow a balanced approach to wealth management, aiming to capitalize on both the large pool of wealth within mature markets as well as the significant growth in wealth in Asia Pacific and other emerging markets.

We serve our clients through three regionally focused divisions: Swiss Universal Bank, International Wealth Management and Asia Pacific. These regional businesses are supported by an integrated global Investment Bank. Our Asset Management business is managed as a separate division, emphasizing the strategic importance of the asset management business for the bank and its clients. ","

Your field of responsibility

As a T24 Support Engineer/SRE, you would work with the Change, Platform and Business teams to improve the reliability of systems, decrease the operational risk, improve productivity and enhance end-user experience.

Project delivery (50%)

  • Drive DevOps and SRE culture/practices within the team.
  • Build deployment pipelines for new and existing applications.
  • Build utilities and tools to enhance IT operations.
  • Coordinate with the Application Development teams for the design and rollout of Cloud native / traditional applications.
  • Assist with the functional and technical specifications for outstanding system bugs or enhancements.
  • Play key role in prioritization of changes and tracking the delivery.
  • Work with engineering/platform team to ensure high standards in system design so that technology operations risks is minimized and that application data is appropriately structured, controlled and utilized within the business.
  • Seek to review and enhance the existing monitoring framework for predictive monitoring and analytics.
  • Build framework to track application performance metrics and identify leading indicators for the production reliability & stability.
  • Curate the project backlog and provide inputs for the sprint planning.
  • Coordinate with Risk & Control team to minimize/eliminate operational risks.

Application Support (50%)

  • As an SRE, provide engineering support for various applications in Core Banking and work with L1/L2/L3 Support analysts from other system platforms and/or IT Operations.
  • Seek to ensure coordination of department across the line teams to handle production incidents, regardless of it being major or minor in nature.
  • Provide issue/incident related guidance, assistance and coordination among inter and intra department teams and follow up on kind ensures resolution.
  • Lead analysis of identified issues or problems which may require changes to procedures, standards or systems. Ensure issues or problems are responded to, resolved, redirected or reported to next support levels.
  • Provide day-to-day support to clients to ensure customer expectations are met and if not, exceeded.
  • Provide point of escalation for minor / major incidents raised post after business hours.
  • Accountable for the quality, correctness, robustness and performance of the delivered solutions to production.
  • Provide on-call/on-site support on a rota basis and afterhours/weekend support as needed, covering application support and application change deployment.

Your future colleagues

 APAC Wealth Management (WM) Core Technology team is responsible for developing and handling the Core Banking Platform for the APAC Private and Wealth Management business. There are a number of new and exciting projects that are going on and are in pipeline.

APAC WM Core Support team is one of the robust support teams in the organization. The team has worked hard over last few years to improve the production stability of the Core Banking system. We are now embarking on a journey to transform the team from being a support team into a support engineering / SRE team. Along with stability, the team would work to improve the reliability of the platform and to ensure the operational risk framework of the core banking system is robust

Your skills and experience

You are expected to possess the below:

  • Experience in Production tools development and integration is required
  • DevOps Experience related to setting up CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins/Teamcity/GitLab is required
  • Able to write Groovy based Jenkins files and experience in other code based orchestration tools like Salt.
  • Experience in Docker and Kubernetes / OpenShift is required.
  • Experience in public cloud platforms, especially Azure, is required.
  • Familiarity with Agile and Scrum based development methodology.
  • Experience in using Atlassian suite of products like Bitbucket, Confluence, JIRA
  • Knowledge of T24 core banking system is preferred.
  • Knowledge in T24 related technologies like TOCF, TAFJ, ORACLE, Integration & Iteration framework, DLM, Relational-Replication, TEMENOS Data-lake etc. are preferred
  • Experience in JAVA programming is required.
  • Experience in Springboot and Angular frameworks is a plus
  • Experience in Python scripting or Scala programming is helpful.
  • Experience in writing complex Splunk queries and building dashboards will be helpful.
  • Fair knowledge on the private banking business processes and functions will be an advantage.
  • Ability to collaborate with teams, onsite and offshore, in delivering the solutions.
  • Good problem solving skills along with strong presentation skills (in a meeting room and in remote meeting place).
  • Fully aligned with CS internal policy and control standards.
  • Experience in handling offshore team's work and good management reporting skills.
  • Vendor coordination (handling the vendor contracts and work closely with them in delivering the projects).
  • Explore new technologies and solutions to improve the current and upcoming application stack.

Your new employer

Find a new home for your skills, ideas, and ambitions. Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to progress your career, attractive benefits and excellent training.

We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for motivated individuals to help us shape the future for our clients.

Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. We are committed to building a culture of inclusion with a deep sense of belonging for all of us. We will consider flexible working opportunities where possible. Our bank provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, as well as those with other needs or beliefs as may be protected under applicable local law. If you require assistance during the recruitment process, please let your recruiter know.

364,cloud engineer,/en/job/senior-devops-engineer-passenger-processing-systems-and-azure-cloud-operations-9358908,9358908,Senior DevOps Engineer - Passenger Processing Systems and Azure Cloud Operations,False,False,,,SGD,AMADEUS GDS SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.,8-Mar-22,False,,,199800953Z,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"
Amadeus is a leading transaction processor for the global travel and tourism industry, providing transaction processing power and technology solutions to both travel providers (including full service carriers, low-cost airlines, hotels, rail, cruise and ferry operators, car rental companies and tour operators) and travel agencies.
","

Job Description

  • Analyzes software and hardware requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints.
  • Participates in designing, coding, testing, integrating, debugging, configuring, and documenting of software products.
  • Consults with customer and Product Management concerning maintenance and product evolution of software system.
  • Designs and implements interfaces and middleware software for the integration of Amadeus Airport IT products into the airport/aviation industry and operating environments.
  • Diagnoses and resolves software and hardware problems.
  • Applies generally accepted programming standards and techniques to assure efficient program logic and data manipulation.
  • Optimises productions platforms and operation procedures.
  • Prepares documentation on how to operate platforms and trains the operation staff as necessary.
  • Supports operation staff with complex problems and acts as an expert within one or more specific areas.
  • Coordinates technical installation of new releases of software with Release Management, Product Management, and on-site Operations.
  • Monitors, tests and benchmarks new infrastructure technology and support tools in order to continuously improve solutions to Amadeus’ and customer needs in this area.
  • Handles 3rd level support production calls.
  • Creates and maintains reference platforms.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering
  • Minimum 5 years related work experience in DevOps
  • Basic knowledge of airport and airline operations.
  • General knowledge of Amadeus fundamentals: history, business, offer, strategy, technology and organization.

Specialist:

  • Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA) on Windows, preferably MCSE.
  • Windows Client OS.
  • Windows Server OS.
  • Windows administration and policies.
  • Windows registry.
  • Intermediate:
  • General knowledge of MS Azure, AWS, Citrix, VMWare.
  • Experience in PowerShell scripting, Java and HTML5/CSS/JavaScript, RDBMS experience (e.g. Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL), networking (TCP/IP, DNS, routers, firewalls, load-balancing, troubleshooting tools).
  • Unassisted Windows platform installer.
  • Understanding of peripheral management in windows.
  • Experience in working with Atlassian products.
  • Experience in handling GIT, Stash, Jenkins, Maven and Jira to implement release processes, build configurations and development tools.
  • Experience in Build Management - Managing the process and tools user for builds. (GIT, Stash, Jenkins, Maven, Ant).
  • Experience in multi-site, parallel development, branching and merging by using GIT.

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

column1:
","

GovTech’s Government Digital Services (GDS) aims to spearhead the digital transformation of the Government. As part of this progressive group, you will join a multi-disciplinary team to modernize the way digital applications and services are developed, deployed and maintained across the Whole-of-Government. Our objective is to augment engineering teams with platforms and services that shortens time-to-market and improves operational agility. We employ DevOps principles and ‘shift-left’ technologies in creating solutions in areas like continuous integration/deployment, data sharing as well as applications observability, testing and security.

If you are looking for opportunities to collaborate with industry experts and work with highly motivated peers, we welcome you to join GDS Engineering Productivity (ENP).

This is an exciting position with many opportunities for groundbreaking contributions. You will be a consultant in the team who knows what needs to be in place to enable the platform to work, while managing security risks.

What you will be working on:

As a Lead/Senior Cybersecurity Consultant in the security team,

  • Work with stakeholders such as developers, infrastructure and platform engineers, etc. to achieve security objectives in an Agile setting
  • Lead, coordinate and plan for timely security assessments
  • Conduct security risk assessments at various levels – application, infrastructure, network, etc.
  • Explore, implement and/or use security tools if required to meet security objectives
  • Work with infra engineers and developers to remediate security risks from assessments
  • Consolidate and report metrics for security risk assessments
  • Review and manage change requests from a security risk perspective in an Agile setting
  • Enhance visibility and track security assessments through ticketing tools
  • Act as team lead, mentor and coach for the cybersecurity team (5)

What we are looking for:

  • Minimum of 7 years’ experience with cybersecurity consultancy or related scope of work
  • Passion in driving for DevSecOps (and/or DevOps) transformation
  • Passion for automation and security best practices
  • Experience with architecting using cloud providers like AWS, GCP, Azure
  • Experience with Source Code Review in an enterprise setting
  • Experience with Penetration Testing in an enterprise setting
  • Experience with DevOps toolset like JIRA, BitBucket, Confluence
  • Experience with Agile methodologies

Added advantage if you possess the following:

  • Experience with these security tools in the enterprise setting: Hashicorp Vault, Splunk Enterprise, Tenable, HP Fortify, Sonatype Nexus IQ
  • Experience with security assessments pertaining to government projects
  • Security certifications or qualifications

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

Responsibilities:
  • Implement and operate highly scalable, robust, distributed systems on cloud.
  • Automate infrastructure using configuration management tools and scriptings.
  • To monitor systems daily and respond to security concerns.
  • Deploy and manage solutions on cloud with CI/CD pipelines.
  • Work with software engineers to analyze business requirements and propose solutions using right technologies.
  • Troubleshoot and create tools to resolve incidents proactively.
  • To prepare and maintain technical documentation.
  • Provide first level after-hours support.
  • To optimize infrastructure around cost, system security, geographical proximities etc.
  • To lead and manage devops engineers.

Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
  • At least 5 years of hands-on experience as DevOps engineer, preferably in Senior or Lead position.
  • AWS solution architect certified is a must.
  • Expertise in infrastructure automation tools: Ansible, Salt, Chef, Puppet, or CloudFormation.
  • Expertise in administration, configuration, optimization and monitoring of both Linux(CentOS, ubuntu and Amazon Linux) and Windows Server.
  • Expertise in administering CI/CD tools such as Git, Jira, GitLab, or Jenkins
  • Experienced in setting up monitoring tools like ELK, Splunk, Grafana, cloud watch etc.
  • Experienced with Microservice and Container based application architectures.
  • (Preferably with AWS)
  • Experienced in containerization technologies (Kubernetes, EKS, ECS, Docker Platform).
  • Solid understanding of networking, network routing, and strong troubleshooting skills.
  • Good scripting skills for automation - bash, python, ruby etc.
  • Understanding of .NET Core framework will be a plus.
  • Comprehensive debugging and troubleshooting skills.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a team.
  • Standby duty required for off-hours support.
Interested candidates please submit your resume to cv.it@recruithaus.com.sg

column2:
Ufinity provides the industry's most innovative and integrated business Information Technology (IT) systems for Asia's leading enterprises, including large multinational groups, educational institutions and government ministries and agencies. We continue to be the driver of innovative solutions, delivering many industry's firsts with exceptional value. Incorporated in 2001, Ufinity Pte Ltd is a highly successful IT solutions engineering company which specializes in the implementation of enterprise software and services. Today, the company employs more than 200 developers and engineers with strong expertise and experience in Custom Solutions Development, New Media and IT Security, especially in Identity Access Management. Our solution strategy provides our customers unmatched benefits from leading standard software and systems, including excellent system availability, scalability, process efficiency and powerful performance.  Brand Philosophy Our vision guides our business by identifying what we need to accomplish for sustainable, quality growth. Inspiring Vision Our vision guides our business by identifying what we need to accomplish for sustainable, quality growth.Achieving Pinnacle of Excellence that Wins Customer's Trust and Drives Company Growth. Corporate Mission We achieve our pinnacle of excellence with: Domain insights backed by strong expertise Industry knowledge acquired through extensive experience Engineering excellence established by continuous improvement Customer intimacy achieved by understanding customer needs Technology leadership reinforced by innovation and alliances Values At Ufinity, we have some core values that drive us and makes us who we are.  We are proactive. We take initiative, pride, passion and drive in performing our work. We continuously improve ourselves. We believe that continuously improving and adapting ourselves will create the greatest value to our customers. We are solution focused. We analyse problems in a clear and organised manner and apply innovative and creative ideas towards the design and implementation of a solution. We believe in team work. We collaborate extensively and interact and exchange ideas and knowledge with each other regularly. The interactions generate far better ideas than an individual. We adopt a customer focus mentality. We  put  our  customers  first,  understand  their  expectations,  anticipate,  assess and respond in a timely manner to changing customer needs. We search out ways to enhance customer satisfaction by improving efficiency and effectiveness of service delivery. We constantly seek to achieve win-win situations. We believe in professionalism. We believe in being fair, trustworthy and accountable for our work. We respect others and ourselves.  ","

Role Responsibilities

  • Provide professional technical support to Cloud system infrastructure and operation system during the maintenance phase solutions deployed by Ufinity
  • Identify, analyze and devise solutions to Cloud infrastructure system problem
  • Ensure that managed systems and configurations meet expectation, quality standards, and within schedule
  • Effectively documenting issues and providing regular status and progress towards project milestones

For Senior Position

  • Review and enhance existing Cloud infrastructure and related tasks/processes
  • Provide consultative support to development, operations, and pre-sales teams

Role Requirements:

  • Diploma with few years relevant experience/ Degree in IT / Computer Science or related field
  • Possess good analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience in administration of Unix/Linux Servers, Windows Servers
  • Solid scripting skills in Shell, PHP, Perl or Python
  • Experience in Amazon Web Services such as EC2, CloudWatch, CloudFront, ELB/ ALB, Route53, S3 etc.
  • A team player who takes ownership
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
  • Able to work in projects independently as well as with teams

What differentiates People Profilers from every other recruiter is our unwavering commitment to building relationships with our clients- understanding exactly what our clients are after, and allowing us to match their precise needs. We deliver human capital solutions that allow organisations and their employees to succeed.

Here at People Profilers, we pride ourselves on being a one-stop human capital solutions provider for your organisation. Our innovative and relationship-focused workforce solutions have been provided across a wide range of industries.

column3: <div>
<div>

column4: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

column3: <div>

column4: NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

column3: <div>

column4: Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

column3: <div>

column4: Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column3: For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

column1:
","
The School of Electrical Electronic Engineering invites application for the position of Senior Research Engineer.The Senior Research Engineer will be responsible to translate high-level audio algorithms implemented in other audio prototyping software into a high-performance, architecture-specific code. He/ will work closely with other researchers to design and implement DSP algorithms that meet system-level constraints and will also be defining and implementing software architecture for real-time audio systems on prototype hardware containing a multitude of co-processors.
Job Responsibilities
  • Writing, debugging, optimizing and testing of source code with an emphasis on audio applications
  • Maintenance and improvement of existing audio algorithm code base including noise reduction, acoustic echo cancellation, automatic gain control, voice activity detection, packet loss compensation and other audio enhancements
  • Cloud and Edge programming
  • Supporting RD and Feasibility Studies including defining the scope and goals of audio research tasks and completion of detailed reports on results and recommendations for development activities
  • Software development of new algorithmic audio processing solutions including the existing areas mentioned above and additionally including state of the art audio codecs, audibility and intelligibility enhancements, microphone array processing, 3D audio and other audio effects and enhancements
  • Project manment tasks including creation and maintenance of requirements and schedule documentation for assigned projects, project budget etc.
  • Publish journal and conference papers as dictated by the assigned projects
Job Requirements
  • Master's  in Electrical/Computer Engineering with emphasis in audio and acoustics signal processing
  • More than 5  of technical and research experience

  • Experience conducting acoustic measurements using standard acoustic equipment (speakers, microphones, anechoic chambers, acoustic mannequins)

  • Ability to effectively contribute in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment
  • Preferred experience with spatial audio, acoustic room modeling, collecting, organizing and analyzing large data sets
  • Experience with speaker or microphone arrays, or machine learning is a huge plus

column1: 371,cloud engineer,/en/job/programs-and-alliances-manager-asean-9395359,9395359,"Programs and Alliances Manager, ASEAN",False,False,,,SGD,ECLOUDVALLEY TECHNOLOGY PTE. LTD.,18-Mar-22,False,,5 days,201911448G,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">
<div>

Founded in 2014 as a born-in-the-cloud partner focused entirely on AWS services, eCloudvalley has grown to 380+ employees with geographic footprints across APAC region, in Taiwan, Hong Kong, China, Philippines, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, and United States. eCloudvalley is the notable vendor in the Asia Pacific regional contextualization of the Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud infrastructure MSP on Gartner.

With a mission to evolve the customer’s business with cloud technology, eCloudvalley has built a professional technical team with over 500 AWS certifications and has served 1,000 enterprises to perform any digital transformation. Our core competencies include Cloud Migration, Managed Services Provider, Data Solution, SAP, DB Freedom, Cloud Training, DevOps, Serverless, and Containers.

Our business has been growing and expanding rapidly and we are looking for new talents to join us. If you are a person with entrepreneur mindset and would like to be a part to disrupt the market, you may be one of the people that we need!
","

Job Description:

  • Manage all AWS-related programs (AWS Partner Programs, POC/POA, MAP, ISV funding related, Windows, Prospecting Day, Webinars, Events, etc.)
  • Be the point of contact for all AWS-specific BU’s (Data Team, SAP Team, Migration Team, etc.)
  • Look for win-win opportunities to extend the relationship by expanding the existing partnership with AWS in ASEAN.
  • Work cross-functionally across eCloudvalley teams (sales, marketing, engineering, operations) to define, develop, and execute GTM program with AWS.
  • Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to qualify, develop, and execute campaigns to generate new business opportunities in ASEAN.
  • Manage all AWS Partner Account information, including the Partner Scorecard, Account Details, and the AWS Partner Solutions Finder Listing.
  • Manage all 3rd Party key partnerships related to the AWS business such as Trend Micro, Crowdstrike, Intel, Druva, and others.
  • Work with country leaders to determine best-fit partnerships to nurture and grow.
  • Establish relationships

Key Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field required
  • Marketing professional with at least 5 years experience managing revenue-generating Marketing programs and strategies within the tech/cloud industry
  • Excellent knowledge of and demonstrable experience in marketing program management and the ability to make impactful decisions
  • Highly motivated, energetic individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and comes with start-up 'anything and everything' mentality.
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to establish positive relationships with team members and senior stakeholders
  • Outstanding written, verbal communication, and presentation skills.

What is in it for you?

  • Attractive remuneration package, benefit & year-end bonus
  • Excellent career development
  • 5-day work with flexible work schedule

Interested candidates are invited to apply online. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you for applying

column3: Tencent is a world-leading internet and technology company that develops innovative products and services to improve the quality of life for people around the world.

Founded in 1998 with its headquarters in Shenzhen, China, Tencent's guiding principle is to use technology for good. Our communication and social services connect more than one billion people around the world, helping them to keep in touch with friends and family, access transportation, pay for daily necessities, and even be entertained.
Tencent also publishes some of the world's most popular video games and other high-quality digital content, enriching interactive entertainment experiences for people around the globe.
Tencent offers a range of services such as cloud computing, advertising, FinTech, and other enterprise services to support our clients' digital transformation and business growth.

  • •Provide cloud security solutions, including security solutions in public cloud, private cloud, and hybrid cloud architecture environments.

  • •Be familiar with the management security service and security products of third-party security companies;
  • •Summarize the safety requirements of customers, collect and analyze the technical data of the exhibition, provide input for product development and research;
  • •Responsible for the output and implementation of cloud security solutions;
  • •Participate in the needs assessment of cloud security products, planning and verification it in the marketing;
  • •In-depth mining and analysis of customer security requirements to provide input for the R&D;
  • •Leading partner manufacturers’ product and service introduction, joint product development, project cooperation, etc.;

Qualifications

  • •At least 5 years of cyber security pre-sales work experience and be familiar with the network security status and safety requirements;
  • •Independently responsible for the security scheme planning and implementation of more than 3 large-scale (above million dollars) projects;
  • •Be familiar with the security compliance requirements and standards;
  • •Have leadership communication skills and strong understanding of customer needs;
  • •Have background in cloud computing technology and is sensitive to new technologies;
  • •Have understanding of security in big data and data platform field;
  • •Priority admission through Tencent Cloud technology certification or equivalent qualification certification.
